Policy: Decreto Nº 319 - Ley de financiamiento rural para el Estado de Michoacán de Ocampo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco jurídico para que se disponga de recursos financieros accesibles, con intereses bajos, oportunos y suficientes para el desarrollo rural en el Estado de Michoacán. En particular la Ley propicia la coordinación con los órdenes de gobierno para impulsar políticas públicas y programas en el medio rural que serán considerados prioritarios para el desarrollo de la entidad y que estarán orientados a las siguientes acciones: a) fortalecer la planeación del financiamiento para el desarrollo rural; b) participar con las dependencias y entidades competentes en el impulso de la producción primaria agropecuaria, forestal, piscícola, recursos renovables, actividades secundarias, terciarias y en general toda actividad económica; c) impulsar mecanismos para la transformación e industrialización de bienes y consolidar los servicios rurales; d) fortalecer esquemas diferenciados de financiamiento en el medio rural estatal; e) promover el bienestar social y económico de los productores, de sus comunidades, de los trabajadores del campo y de los agentes de la sociedad rural, mediante la diversificación y la generación de empleo, incluyendo todas las actividades lícitas que se desarrollan en el medio rural; f) contribuir al arraigo de la población rural; g) fortalecer la organización social y productiva. El Sistema Estatal de Financiamiento Rural previsto por la Ley tiene como objetivo coadyuvar en el establecimiento de las condiciones para que todos los proyectos sustentables de los micro, pequeños y medianos empresarios del sector rural del Estado de Michoacán cuenten con la posibilidad de tener acceso a formas de financiamiento suficiente.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Prevención y Control de Deficiencias de Micronutrientes  2008 - 2015.
Policy_Content: El Plan Nacional de Prevención y Control de Deficiencias de Micronutrientes 2008-2015, tiene por Objetivo general prevenir y reducir de manera sostenida las deficiencias de vitaminas y minerales en la población del país evitando excesos y desbalances, con énfasis en los grupos vulnerables y excluidos. Constituyen sus Objetivos específicos; 1) Determinar la situación nutricional de los micronutrientes en la población panameña; 2) Prevenir y reducir la anemia por deficiencia de hierro en los recién nacidos e incrementar los depósitos de hierro en las niñas y niños menores de 6 meses a nivel nacional mediante la prevención de la anemia durante el embarazo, la aplicación de la práctica de la ligadura tardía del cordón umbilical y la lactancia materna exclusiva; 3) Prevenir y reducir la anemia en niñas y niños menores de 5 años (prioridad menores de tres años), escolares y en las mujeres embarazadas a nivel nacional, mediante el uso combinado de estrategias de suplementación medicamentosa, intervenciones en salud primaria, diversificación de la dieta y biofortificación, entre otras estrategias y prácticas innovadoras; 4) Prevenir y reducir la deficiencia de cinc en niñas y niños menores de 5 años y contribuir a la disminución de las enfermedades diarreicas agudas y la desnutrición crónica; 5) Eliminar virtualmente la deficiencia de vitamina A en el país, reducir la prevalencia en poblaciones indígenas y contribuir a la disminución de las infecciones prevalentes de la infancia y la mortalidad infantil, a través de la suplementación a menores de 5 años con megadosis bianuales de vitamina A; 6) Mantener los logros obtenidos en el control de los desórdenes por deficiencia de yodo (la eliminación virtual de los DDI) y evitar los excesos, mediante el consumo universal de la sal adecuadamente yodada; 7) Prevenir y reducir la incidencia de defectos del tubo neural mediante la suplementacicón con ácido fólico a las mujeres en edad fértil en distritos prioritarios y la fortificación de alimentos de consumo masivo con ácido fólico y vitaminas del complejo B.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Combate a la Desnutrición Infantil  2008 - 2015.
Policy_Content: El Plan Nacional de Combate a la Desnutrición Infantil 2008 - 2015, tiene por objetivo general reducir la prevalencia de desnutrición moderada y severa en niños de 0 a 36 meses. El presente Plan se centrará en los grupos más vulnerables a la desnutrición como son la madre embarazada, la lactante y el niño menor de 36 meses en distritos prioritarios del país. Policy: Law No. 6.904 providing for the State Policy of Cooperatives within the State of Alagoas.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting 15 articles divided into five Chapters, provides for the State Policy of Cooperatives within the State of Alagoas. This State Policy consists of a set of guidelines and rules aimed at encouraging cooperative activity and its development in the State. The State Executive Branch shall stimulate the activities of the Cooperatives, encouraging a support system for the growth of cooperative activity. The objectives of the State Policy are: to create instruments and mechanisms that stimulate the growth of cooperative activities; to provide educational and technical assistance to cooperatives based in the State of Alagoas, in partnership with OCB/AL - Union and Organization of Brazilian Cooperatives of the State of Alagoas; to establish incentives for the constitution, maintenance, promotion and development of the cooperative system of the State; to support technically and operationally cooperatives in the State promoting partnerships for the development of the State Cooperative System; to stimulate the cooperative form of social, economic and cultural organization in the various branches of action, based on the general principles of society; to encourage the inclusion of cooperative study in schools; to create mechanisms for the implementation of new cooperative societies; to spread government policies in favour of state cooperative societies; to organize the general register of the Cooperative Societies.

Policy: Loi n°006/PR/2008 du 3 janvier 2008 instituant la Charte des investissements de la République du Tchad.
Policy_Content: La présente loi institue la Charte des investissements de la République du Tchad. La Charte des investissements de la République du Tchad, adoptée en application des dispositions de la Charte des investissements de la CEMAC, constitue le cadre général de promotion des investissements tant nationaux qu’étrangers du secteur privé. La présente Charte s’applique aux investissements productifs réalisés principalement dans les domaines d’activités suivantes : les activités industrielles comportant un stage de transformation ou de conditionnement des produits ; les activités de préparation ou de transformation des produits d’origine végétale, animale et piscicole ; les activités d’exploration et de recherches géologiques, minières et pétrolières ; les activités d’exploitation des substances minérales, de leur transformation et activités connexes ; les activités de production et de distribution d’énergie et d’eau ; les activités de mise en valeur d’autres sources d’énergie solaire, éolienne ; les activités de fabrication et de montage d’articles ou d’objets de grande consommation;  les activités d’exploitation touristique et hôtelière ; les industries de bâtiments, travaux publics et transports ; les activités de maintenance des équipements industriels ; les technologies de l’information et de la communication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 4-1152 “On forest management for hunting”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that hunting management on forest parcels shall be carried out by legal persons and individual entrepreneurs in accordance with forest parcel lease contracts. Hunting management in protected areas shall be prohibited. Forest parcels used for captive breeding of wild fauna species subject to hunting must be located at a distance of no less than 1,000 metres from residential areas. Forest parcels for hunting management shall be allotted to the applicants through tenders. Hunting managers shall be granted the following rights: (a) use forest parcel, allotted in accordance with lease contract, for hunting management; (b) procure forest resources for organization of hunting; and (c) render services for hunting, captive breeding, grant the use of edible and non-edible non-timber forest resources, including medicinal plants and fuelwood, to hunters. Hunting managers must: (a) use forest parcels for specified purposes; (b) pay agreed rental fee within established deadline; (c) submit annually forest declaration; (d) ensure protection and conservation of wild fauna species, including endangered and protected ones; and (e) register annually the number of wild fauna species and the number of shot species and submit data to the authorized state wildlife management institution.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Act on the structural aid to agriculture (No. 1476 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Act aims at the promotion of agricultural production efficiency and quality in accordance with the principles of sustainable development. This Act shall apply to aid granted for the improvement of agricultural structures and funded by the European Community and the corresponding national funds or entirely from national funds. This Act does not apply to assistance or compensation to farmers for the cessation of production activities, to assistance funded by the European Community Structural Funds or the European Fisheries Fund and financial assistance granted pursuant to other specified legislation. Aid can be in the form of loans. The Act, among other things, sets out the conditions for and of financial assistance. Materials and practices used must meet requirements of environment protection and of the National Land Use and Building Act.

Policy: Loi n° 07-018 portant Code de l’Environnement de la République Centrafricaine.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de définir le cadre juridique de la gestion de l’environnement qui constitue un patrimoine de la nation. Sa protection et sa gestion sont d’intérêt général et universel. Tout citoyen centrafricain a droit à un environnement sain dans les conditions définies par les textes juridiques nationaux et internationaux en vigueur. Cette loi est composée de 5 titres: titre I traite des dispositions générales; titre II de la gestion de l’environnement notamment la protection des eaux, du sol, du sous-sol, la gestion de la biodiversité, de substances et produits chimiques dangereux, des nuisances sonores et lumineuses, etc.; titre III de la protection du patrimoine environnemental; titre IV de la répression des infractions; titre V des dispositions transitoires et finales.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1851 validating the Regulation on state supervision over the state, management, protection, conservation of forest fund and reforestation.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of state supervision over the state, management, protection, conservation of forest fund and reforestation. State supervision shall be carried out by the officials of State Forest Service subordinated to the Ministry of Forest Management and by the officials of the State Inspection for Protection of Animal and Vegetable Kingdom attached to the President of the Republic of Belarus. The aforesaid officials shall have the following plenary powers: (a) request forest-related information from forest managers of all the categories; (b) inspect plots of forests fund subject to forest management; (c) verify forest management documentation; (d) give order for remedy of defaults related to the infringement of forest legislation; (e) make decisions for suspension (restriction) of forest management practices; and (f) draw up reports on administrative offences related to forest management.

Policy: Regional Law No. 427 VH-II “On agricultural development”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of granting state support to the producers of agricultural commodities and sustainable development of rural areas. Producers of agricultural commodities shall be recognized organization or individual entrepreneur producing or processing agricultural commodities and trading thereof on condition that share of total income related to trade of the aforesaid commodities shall be no less than 70 percent, citizens conducting subsidiary smallholding, consumer cooperatives and peasant farms. State support of the producers of agricultural commodities shall be granted in the following forms: (a) reimbursement of expenditure for purchase of primary materials and fuel for agricultural purposes; (b) partial compensation of interests on credits allocated by the Russian financial organizations for agricultural purposes; (c) public investments in agriculture; and (d) promotion of various forms of lease.

Policy: Program to Reduce Maternal and Infant Mortality in Republic of Kazakhstan for 2008-2010.
Policy_Content: This is nationwide multi-sectoral policy document setting forth the goal of reducing maternal and infant mortality by introduction of modern approaches with proven effectiveness in the field of maternal and child health protection. It sets forth the following objectives: (a) improvement and implementation of regulatory and legal acts regulating maternal and infant health with the consideration of international approaches; (b) introduction of criteria for rational planning in the field of maternal and infant health care, and  regionalization of perinatal healthcare assistance; (c) advanced training and retraining of personnel in the field of maternal and infant health care sphere, taking into account the technologies to be introduced, with a focus on primary medical care; (d) improvement of the material and technical base of obstetrical and pediatric institutions; (e) improving interaction and continuity of health care services to ensure quality medical care for women and children; (e) development of inter-sectoral and inter-agency cooperation related to maternal and child health care; and (f) raising public awareness of effective approaches to maternal and child health care.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 667 regarding expropriation and allotment of land plots.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes the modalities of expropriation and allotment of the plots of land specifying that the type of proprietary right to land plots shall be determined by the purposeful use thereof in accordance with the provisions of the present Presidential Decree. Land plots can be allotted to: (a) citizens on condition of provisional tenancy, lifelong hereditary possession, private ownership and lease; (b) individual entrepreneurs on lease; and (c) legal persons of Belarus on condition of permanent or provisional tenancy, private ownership or lease and to legal persons non-residents on the national territory on condition of lease. Expropriation and allotment of land plots shall be carried out by: (a) the administration of rural communities for the purpose of housing, subsidiary small-holding, gardening, haymaking and grazing; and (b) the district executive bodies for the purpose of forest management and agriculture. Provincial administration and Minsk city council shall be authorized to carry out expropriation of agricultural land, land of protected areas, forest land and transfer the aforesaid expropriated land to other categories of land in accordance with governmental and presidential decisions.

Policy: Regional Law No. 173-OZ “On some types of forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional law establishes the modalities of procurement by citizens of non-timber forest resources, edible non-timber forest resources and medicinal plants for individual personal needs and rules of forest management for hunting. Procurement of non-timber resources in protected areas and protection forests shall be prohibited. In the process of procurement of edible non-timber forest resources citizens must observe forest fire prevention rules and regulations, and also afforestation and reforestation requirements. Picking of berries shall be carried out manually. Procurement of forestry seeds shall be carried out at the ripening stage. Hunting management on forest parcels shall be carried out as a form entrepreneurial activity by legal persona and individual entrepreneurs. Hunting managers shall be authorized: (a) to carry out biotechnical arrangements; (b) procure arboreal and branch fodder; and (c) to keep wild fauna species for captive breeding.

Policy: Décret n° 2007-853/PRES/PM/MCE/MECV/MATD du 26 décembre 2007 portant dispositions réglementaires environnementales particulières pour l’exercice de l’activité minière au Burkina Faso.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret détermine les conditions relatives à la protection de l’environnement en matière de prospection, de recherche et d’exploitation de substances minières ou matériaux de carrière définies par la loi n°031-2003/AN du 08 mai 2003 portant Code minier au Burkina Faso. Il s’applique à toutes les activités et installations régies par le code minier, susceptibles d’affecter directement ou indirectement l’environnement. Les activités et installations régies par le Code minier doivent être conduites dans le respect de la protection et de la préservation de l’environnement conformément aux textes en vigueur, notamment le  code de l’environnement, le code minier ainsi que les lois et textes connexes.

Policy: Regional Law No. 147-Z “On procurement by citizens of non-timber edible forest resources and medicinal plants for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (wild growing fruits, nuts, berries, mushrooms, seeds, wood juices etc.)  and medicinal plants free of charge for individual personal needs. Stay of citizens on forests for procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest products can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Forest Code. Sawing down, felling, cutting and other damaging of trees and shrubbery in the process of procurement of non-timber edible resources shall be prohibited. Picking of berries and seeds shall be carried out manually. Collection of birch juice shall be carried out in areas of mature forest.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 175 “On procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of procurement of non-timber forest resources free of charge for individual personal needs. It shall be applicable to non-edible non-timber forest products. Citizens shall have the right to use hand tools and obtain information related to timber extraction from the authorized forestry institution. Procurement of woody forage shall be performed from felled trees in the process of selective (intermediate) and clear cutting. Felling of trees for the procurement of birchbark and tanbark shall be prohibited. Collection of birchbark shall be performed from dry stand, wind fallen trees and felled trees on felling sites all the year round. Fuelwood collection with diameter up to 4 cm shall be carried out all the year round.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 148-Z “On procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of procurement of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs with the consideration of conservation, protection and reproduction of forests. It shall be applicable to non-edible non-timber forest products. Procurement and harvesting of non-timber resources shall be carried out on felling sites. Procurement of fuelwood shall be carried out all the year round with the diameter of dry wood non exceeding 4 cm from felled timber on felling sites. Collection and harvesting of forage non-timber resources can be carried out by citizens all the year round from felled timber in the process of clean cutting and selective cutting on felling sites. Methods used for procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources must prevent exhaustion of available forest resources and ensuring timely reproduction thereof. Stay of citizens in forests can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Article 11 of Forest Code.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Non-timber products,Forest species,Fuelwood

Policy: Standards Law No. 13/ NA.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of twelve Chapters, establishes the Law on Standards. It specifies principles, rules, measures regarding the establishment, activities, management, and inspection of standards and technical regulations for products, goods, services, processes, and the environment. To encourage, improve and ensure the production, services, social economic and environment protection in order to have the quality, efficiency, justice and rights, and the legitimate interests and safety of consumers in manufacturing, and will be a factor in managing the nation's economy and development. The Decree is divided as follows: General Provisions (I); Types of Standards (II); Standards and Technical Regulations (III); Organizations Responsible for formulating Standards (IV); Conformity to Standards And Technical Regulations (V); Management system and Testing Systems (VI) Accreditation and Certification (VII); Rights and Obligations of Suppliers and Consumers (VIII); Restrictions (IX); Management and Inspection of Standardizations (X); Awards and Sanctions (XI) and Conclusion (XII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Air & atmosphere, Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Cultivated plants, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Loi n° 07-072 du 26 décembre 2007 relative aux fonds national d’appui aux collectivités territoriales.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée le fonds national d’appui aux collectivités territoriales (AFNACT) chargé est destiné à: assurer la péréquation des ressources d’Investissement entre les Collectivités Territoriales; assurer la compensation des charges induites par les transferts de compétences effectués par l’Etat au profit des Collectivités Territoriales; soutenir la réalisation d’investissements locaux et régionaux sous maîtrise d’ouvrage des Collectivités Territoriales; assurer la garantie des emprunts autorisées des Collectivités Territoriales; contribuer au renforcement de la solidarité entre Collectivité Territoriales dans le cadre de l’inter-collectivité; et contribuer au renforcement du fonctionnement des Collectivités.   Un décret pris en Conseil des Ministres fixe les modalités de gestion du Fonds National d’Appui aux Collectivités Territoriales.

Policy: Regional Law No. 73 “On agricultural development”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between natural and legal persons, recognized as producers of agricultural commodities in accordance with the acting legislation, and other natural and legal persons, state bodies in the sphere of agricultural development. Policy: Regional Law No. 100-RZ “On regulation of forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that forest management, conservation, protection and reproduction of forest shall be carried out by the authorized regional forest institution. Regional forest scheme shall include forest planning. Collection and harvesting of protected and endangered edible and non-edible forest products and prohibited crops by citizens shall be prohibited. Timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs shall be regulated by purchase and sale contract of forest species. This Regional Law establishes maximum allowable limits for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs. Hunting management in forests shall be regulated by hunting management contracts and forest parcels lease contracts.

Policy: Regional Law No. 158-OZ “On public environmental audit”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure realization of the right of citizens to favourable environment and public participation in environmental protection activity. Public environmental audit shall be performed in order to ensure compliance of economic entities with the provisions of environmental legislation. Social environmental inspectors shall be formed on voluntary basis by citizens of majority age with special skills, experience and training in the sphere of environmental protection. Social environmental inspectors shall perform the following duties: (a) inspection of economic entities with a view of identification negative environmental impact; (b) inspection of territory with a view of identification of environmental pollution; (c) draw reports related to environmental pollution; and (d) exercise other rights envisaged by the federal legislation.

Policy: Alternative Dispute Resolution Act 2007
Policy_Content: This Act seeks to improve case management in the Courts exercising criminal and civil jurisdiction by applying alternative dispute resolution in accordance with this Act. Prior to the trial of any criminal or civil proceeding either party may make application to the court having control of the proceeding for any order necessary to protect the interests of either party or to ensure that a fair trial of all the issues is facilitated. The court may refer parties to a dispute to attend mediation prior to or during the hearing of any civil matter in dispute. The Act sets out the procedure of such mediation. Regulations made under this Act may prescribe procedures and powers for courts to conduct pre-trial conferences in criminal and civil proceedings. These Regulations notwithstanding, a court may adopt and apply procedures for pre-trial conferences as it sees fit. The Act also concerns referral to arbitration under the Arbitration Act 1976 and reconciliation procedures.

Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Oceania, Polynesia, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

State support shall be granted in the form of public investments, subsidies and co-financing of expenditure.

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement wallon est relatif à l'octroi de subventions pour la plantation et l'entretien de haies vives, de vergers et d'alignements d'arbres. L’article 2 établit que dans les limites des crédits budgétaires disponibles, une subvention est attribuée pour la plantation ou pour l'entretien de haies vives, de vergers et d'alignements d'arbres aux propriétaires de terrains situés en Région wallonne, ou, avec accord du propriétaire, aux titulaires, sur de tels biens, d'un droit réel en emportant l'usage. Pour pouvoir bénéficier d'une subvention pour la plantation ou pour l'entretien de vergers, le demandeur ne peut avoir retiré de ce type de plantations plus de 50 % de ses revenus imposables durant l'année précédant la demande. Les parcelles agricoles éligibles pour l'octroi de subventions aux mesures agri-environnementales sont exclues du bénéfice des subventions pour l'entretien des haies vives, de vergers et d'alignements d'arbres. Policy: Governmental Regulation No. 258 validating Minimum Requirements for Energy Performance.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes minimum requirements for the energy performance of buildings and the primary data and calculation methods required for verification of the conformity thereof. The scope of application of this Regulation includes residential buildings and other buildings with controlled indoor climate which are under construction or which undergo major renovation, in which indoor climate requirements primarily result from human applications and energy is mainly used for ensuring indoor climate, for heating domestic water and for using domestic and other electrical appliances. Minimum requirements for energy performance shall be the limit rates of summary energy use of existing buildings and buildings under construction, taking account of the usage purpose and the technical characteristics of the buildings, or requirements for utility systems, utilised for measuring the characteristics related to efficiency and their functioning thereof. Minimum requirements for energy performance shall be expressed as an energy performance ratio, which is the reference summary weighted specific use of supplied energies upon standard use of a building. The energy performance ratio reflects the complete energy use of the building for ensuring indoor climate, for heating of domestic water and for using domestic and other electrical appliances. The energy supply of a building shall be energy efficient. A single heat source shall generally be installed in a building. The energy supply of a building shall be energy efficient. A single heat source shall generally be installed in a building.

Policy: Cabinet Order No.830 of 2007 on National Programme for the Assessment and Management of Flood Risks 2008 – 2015
Policy_Content: The National Programme for the Assessment and Management of Flood Risks 2008-2015 has been developed as a mid-term policy planning document in accordance with the task assigned to the Ministry of Environment in Paragraph 2.1 of Cabinet Order No.621 of 17 August 2006, On the Concept “Regarding Measures to be Performed in order to Prevent the Flood Threats Caused in Jēkabpils Following the Creation of Pļaviņas HPS and its Water Reservoirs. The objective of the Programme ties in with the objectives of Directive 2000/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy, the UNECE Helsinki Convention of 1992 On the Protection and Use of Transboundary Watercourses and International Lakes and Directive 2007/60/EC – to establish such water protection system which promotes the reduction of flood impact, as well as a framework for the assessment and management of threats caused by floods, in order to reduce the adverse impact for human health, the environment, cultural heritage and economic activity associated with floods occurring in the Community. In order to achieve the objectives set, the Programme focuses on practical measures which are achievable within the time period referred to, by setting the following sub-objectives and tasks: (1) detailed research of flood risk areas according to the flood risk criteria; (2) preliminary assessment of areas subject to flood risk and planning for further action; (3) clarification of priority areas at risk of flooding and determination of the specific measures for the prevention or reduction of flood risks; and (4) implementation of measures to be performed for the prevention of flood risks and the reduction of flood risks in priority areas.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Flood,Disasters,Risk assessment/management,Coastal zone management,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Cultural heritage

Policy: Southern Sudan Research Council Act (No. 2 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Southern Sudan Research Council as a body corporate. The Council shall be an independent public institution and operate within the Presidency of the Government of Southern Sudan. The Council shall, among other things - formulate a comprehensive policy and design programmes for scientific, engineering and technological research and direct its implementation to ensure efficiency and effectiveness in the management and utilization of human, natural and material resources; promote the protection of intellectual property rights; set standards, priorities, regulations and protocols for research. The Governing Council shall be the highest policy making body of the Council. There shall be specialised committees for, among other things, agricultural, environmental, and gender research.

ICOTERON is an implementing agency of the land policy and colonization of the State, with powers of representation to promote collection of lands, to recognize the legitimate possessions, to dispose of the land cleared, to receive land owned by the Federal Government, and also to promote land regularization in all lands owned by the State of Rondônia. ICOTERON is responsible for: cooperate in formulating and implementing the State's agrarian policy; carry out settler colonization projects, promoting the distribution of land with small producers, non-owners and ex-beneficiaries of land, within the guidelines and objectives of integrated rural development programmes; promote collection of resources destined to land and colonization programmes; adopt the necessary measures for the titling of holdings, respecting the legislation; organize the State Rural Cadastre; etc.

Policy: Ley Nº 26.331 - Ley de presupuestos mínimos de protección ambiental de los bosques nativos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley define los presupuestos mínimos de protección ambiental para el enriquecimiento, restauración, conservación, aprovechamiento y manejo sostenible de los bosques nativos. Asimismo, establece un régimen de fomento y criterios para la distribución de fondos por los servicios ambientales que brindan los bosques nativos. A efectos de la presente Ley, se entienden por servicios ambientales brindados por los bosques nativos los siguientes: a) conservación de la biodiversidad; b) conservación del suelo y de calidad de agua; c) fijación de emisiones de gases con efecto invernadero; d) defensa de la identidad cultural. En particular, la Ley introduce los principios y criterios en base a los cuales cada jurisdicción provincial deberá realizar su propio ordenamiento territorial de bosques, de acuerdo a las categorías de conservación especificadas. Además, la Ley crea el Programa Nacional de Protección de los Bosques Nativos, cuyos objetivos se detallan en el artículo 12. Las restantes disposiciones se refieren al otorgamiento de las autorizaciones para el desmonte y manejo sostenible de bosques nativos (previa Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental), a las sanciones aplicables en caso de infracción y a la creación del Fondo Nacional para el Enriquecimiento y la Conservación de los Bosques Nativos.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 239-pa validating the Regulation on state natural reserve of regional significance “Shoinsky”.
Policy_Content: State natural reserve of regional significance “Shoinsky” is formed for the purpose of conservation of natural complexes and components thereof, natural landscapes and components thereof without expropriation of land plots from owners, tenants and managers thereof. Owners, tenants and managers of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to comply with the regime established in the reserve and bear administrative, criminal and other liability for its violation. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state natural reserve: (a) hunting for all wild fauna species and birds, ruining nests, holes, hollows, dams and other shelters; (b) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical collections, as well as paleontological objects; (b) geological exploration and mining; (c) entry of all types of transport outside public roads and waterways, except for the transport of forestry management bodies, environmental protection, law enforcement agencies and rescue services in the performance of their official activities; (d) allotment of land plots for construction, except for the cases provided for by this Regulation; (e) construction of buildings and structures, roads, pipelines and other communications, except for the cases provided for by this Regulation; and (f) blasting operations. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of state natural reserve: (a) organized recreational activities and tourism; (b) traditional nature management of small indigenous peoples of the North; (c) scientific research and ecological monitoring; (d) recreational and sport fishing in conformity with acting legislation; and (e) traditional activities (haymaking, grazing, collection of mushrooms and berries).

Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Tourism,Indigenous peoples,Traditional rights/customary rights,Research,Monitoring

Policy: Regional Decree No. 238-pa validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of regional significance “More-Yu”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “More-Yu” is a territory of particular importance for the preservation and restoration of natural complexes and their components. The reserve was established with the aim of preserving and studying the wild flora and fauna of the Bolshezemelskaya tundra, including the relict spruce woodlands and archaeological sites. The reserve was formed without expropriation of land from tenants, owners and managers of land. Possessors, owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to comply with the regime established in the reserve and bear administrative, criminal and other liability for its violation. Activities on the territory of the reserve are prohibited if they contradict the goals of its creation or cause harm to natural complexes and their components, including: (a) allotment of land plots for construction, except for the cases provided for by this Regulation; (b) construction of buildings and structures, roads and pipelines and other communications, except for the cases provided for by this Regulation; (c) blasting operations; (d) application and storage of pesticides, mineral fertilizers; and (e) geological exploration and development of minerals. On the territory of the reserve, by agreement with the regional Committee on Ecology shall be authorized the following activities: (a) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical collections, as well as paleontological objects; (b) organized recreational and tourism activities; (c) placement of economic and production facilities of the reserve; and (d) scientific research, including environmental monitoring. The following activities are authorized on the territory of the reserve: (a) recreational and sport fishing in accordance with the fishing rules; (b) recreational and sport hunting in accordance with the hunting rules; (c) traditional use of natural resources by a representative of the indigenous peoples of the North; and (d) grazing of domesticated reindeer in accordance with the project for the organization of reindeer pastures.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Indigenous peoples,Traditional rights/customary rights,Research,Monitoring,Tourism,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora

Policy: Regional Decree No. 237-pa validating the Regulation on state natural complex reserve of regional significance “Vaygach”.
Policy_Content: State natural complex reserve of regional significance “Vaygach” is a territory of particular importance for the preservation and restoration of natural complexes and their components. The reserve was formed with the aim of preserving and restoring wild flora and fauna of Polar regions included in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the regional Red Book, historical and cultural heritage of indigenous peoples of the Far North, arctic landscapes. Declaration of the territory of the reserve is made without expropriation of land plots from tenants, landowners and possessors of land plots. On the territory of the reserve shall be prohibited activities contradicting purposes of its creation or damaging natural complexes and their components, including: (a) allotment  of land plots for construction, except for cases envisaged by this Regulation; (b) construction of buildings and structures, roads and pipelines and other communications, except for cases envisaged by this Regulation; (c) blasting operations; (d) application and storage of pesticides, mineral fertilizers; (e) any other activities, recreational and other types of nature management, hindering conservation, restoration and reproduction of natural complexes and their components, not envisaged by this Regulation; and (f) impacts that violate soil and vegetation cover and cause death of wild fauna species. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of the reserve: (a) recreational and sport hunting in accordance with hunting rules; (b) recreational and sport fishing in accordance with fishing rules; (c) construction of cordons and stopping points to ensure nature conservation and tourism activities; (d) environmental education; (e) traditional use of natural resources by representatives of indigenous peoples; and (f) grazing of domesticated reindeer according to the project of organization of reindeer pastures.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixant le règlement flamand relatif à l'assainissement du sol et à la protection du sol.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixe le règlement flamand relatif à l’assainissement du sol et à la protection du sol. L’article 2 établit que les valeurs guides pour la qualité du sol, visées à l'article 3, paragraphe  2 du susdit Décret ont fixées à l'annexe II, jointe au présent décret. Le troisième titre  intitulé «Assainissement du sol»est le titre plus important de l’arrêté. Notamment, il comprend 15 chapitres comme suit: Identification et inventaire des terrains (I); Agrément des experts en assainissement du sol (II); Obligation d'exécuter et de (pré)financer la reconnaissance descriptive du sol et l'assainissement du sol (III); Reconnaissance d'orientation du sol et reconnaissance descriptive du sol (IV); Assainissement du sol (V); Autres mesures (VI); Exécution volontaire de la reconnaissance descriptive du sol, de l'assainissement du sol ou d'autres mesures (VII); Cession (VIII); Expropriation de terrains (IX); Fermeture d'un établissement à risque (X); Sols aquatiques (XI); L'utilisation des terres excavées (XII); Recours administratif (XIII); Rétributions (XIV); Compétences du Gouvernement flamand (XV). Le texte comprend 237 articles répartis en 5 titres.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1232 validating the Technical Regulation on requirements set for emissions to environment originating from combustion of different fuels in boilers of thermal power plants.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree shall be applicable to boilers operating with: (a) coal; (b) fuel oil; (c) gas; and (d) mixed fuels. In order to keep emissions in compliance with the limits set by this Technical Regulations all the boilers shall comply with the established emission standards. Radiation safety level in storage facilities for fuel and waste shall be in line with norms and standards set by the authorized body for the protection of public health. Thermal power plants shall be equipped with pollution control and treatment facilities. Technical norms of emissions to the atmospheric air establish maximum allowable limits of emissions of particulate pollutants, sulphur and nitrogen oxides.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regional Law No. 50-RZ “On regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of land tenure and protection of land, land-related property and ownership relations, management and disposal of land. Objects of land relations shall be as follows: (a) land as natural object and natural resource; (b) land plots; and (c) land shares and part of land plots. Regional land shall be classified in the following categories: (a) agricultural land; (b) urban land; (c) industrial, energy, transport and defence land; (d) protected areas; (e) forestland; (f) land or waterbodies; and (g) reserve land. Any type of authorized land use shall be selected autonomously in accordance with land zoning and shall not require any specific authorization. Land category shall be specified in land-related documentation (contracts, land cadastre and registration of land rights).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 167-oz “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates forest relations including the issues of forest management and forest ownership, validation of the modalities and the amount of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs, procurement on non-timber forest products and forest management for hunting purposes. Citizens shall be authorized to perform timber extraction for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species in the form of clear and selective cutting. Cutting of trees (birch) for procurement of birchbark shall be prohibited. Plots of forests can be used for hunting management purposes by legal persons and natural persons registered as individual entrepreneurs.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy_Content: Le présent règlement crée et fixe les règles de composition et de fonctionnement du Comité de Pesticides d'Afrique Centrale (CPAC) chargé d’aider les pays membres à établir des mesures phytosanitaires compatibles avec les normes internationales et à leur permettre de se protéger contre les risques découlant de l'importation incontrôlée des produits chimiques et de leur mauvaise utilisation.  Les pesticides ayant obtenu une Autorisation de mise sur le marché ou une Autorisation Provisoire de Vente (APV) portent un numéro de série.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Sea, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Law No. 5603-VS “On environmental audit”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the following basic principles of environmental audit: (a) risk assessment of potential ecological danger in the process of performance of activities; (b) prior complex assessment of possible environmental impact; (c) foresight of environmental protection arrangements and environmental protection provisions; (d) unlimited plenary powers of experts; (e) substantiation and legality of the conclusions of environmental audit; and (f) consideration of public interests. In order to conduct environmental audit for each specific case an expert commission shall be set up by the Ministry of Environmental Protection and natural Resources. An independent expert on environmental audit can be exclusively natural person with the respective education and qualification that is not a government employee.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2008.

Policy: Décret 07-1074 du14 décembre 2007 PR/PM/MP portant institution du mécanisme de mise en œuvre et de suivi de l’initiative de Transparence dans les Industries Extractives (ITIE).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret institue en République du Tchad un mécanisme de mise en œuvre et du suivi de l’Initiative de Transparence des Industries Extractives (ITIE). La mise en œuvre de l’ITIE prend en compte les lois, règlements et actes contractuels du secteur des hydrocarbures et des mines. Toutes les entreprises pétrolières, gazières et minières, publiques et privées, sont tenues d’adhérer à l’ITIE sous la responsabilité du Ministre chargé des Hydrocarbures, le mécanisme composé d’un Haut Comité National de l’ITIE ayant en son sein un Comité de Pilotage et un Secrétariat Technique Permanent.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Law on Environmental Impact Permits (No. 5602–RS of 2007)
Policy_Content: The Law defines a complete list of activities that are subject to mandatory ecological examination in the territory of Georgia, and legal grounds for awareness raising and participation of the public in processes for issuing environmental impact permits for implementation of the activities, conducting an ecological examination when issuing permits, assessing environmental impacts, and making a decision to issue permits. The Law aims to (1) protect, in the course of carrying out activities, human health, the natural environment, as well as cultural and material values; (2) ensure a fundamental right of a citizen under the Constitution of Georgia to obtain complete, objective and timely information about conditions of his/her working and living environment, as well as the involvement of the public in making significant decisions by the State in the field of environmental protection; and (3) take account of the ecological, social, and economic interests of the State and public in the course of making significant decisions in relation to implementation of activities.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Law of Georgia on Georgian National Academy of Sciences (No. 5600–RS of 2007)
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the status, goals, objectives and the rules of activities of the Georgian National Academy of Sciences ('the Academy'). The Georgian National Academy of Sciences is a successor to the ancient Georgian Academies of Gelati and Ikalto, and is a feature of the high level intellectual development of the State, and a scientific adviser of the Government of Georgia, and a union of persons with international scientific achievements and high level scientific and civic competence. The Academy is a legal entity under public law based on membership. It consists of full members (academicians) and associate members of the Academy, as well as honorary academicians and foreign members of the Academy. The Academy is a scientific advisor of the Government of Georgia.

Policy: Ley de Promoción y Desarrollo de los Bioenergéticos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco normativo para la promoción y el desarrollo de los bioenergéticos, con el fin último de conseguir la diversificación energética en el país. En este contexto, la Ley promueve la producción de insumos para bioenergéticos a partir de las actividades agropecuarias, forestales, algas, procesos biotecnológicos y enzimáticos del campo, sin poner en riesgo la seguridad y soberanía alimentaria del país. Asimismo, la Ley regula la coordinación entre los gobiernos federal, estatales y municipales en este sector. Además, crea la Comisión Intersecretarial para el Desarrollo de los Bioenergéticos.

Policy: Ley Nº 29151 - Ley general del Sistema Nacional de Bienes Estatales. Texto Único Ordenado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece las normas que regulan el ámbito, organización, atribuciones y funcionamiento del Sistema Nacional de Bienes Estatales, en el marco del proceso de modernización de la gestión del Estado y en apoyo y fortalecimiento al proceso de descentralización. Las normas contenidas en la presente Ley, normas reglamentarias y aquellas que emita la Superintendencia Nacional de Bienes Estatales (SBN) son de estricto cumplimiento para las entidades que conforman el Sistema Nacional de Bienes Estatales, en concordancia con las competencias y autonomías atribuidas por la Constitución Política del Perú y las leyes correspondientes; asimismo, para las personas naturales o jurídicas que ejerzan algún derecho sobre bienes estatales. Para los efectos de esta Ley, los bienes estatales se circunscriben a los predios, tales como terrenos, áreas de playa, islas, y otros de dominio privado y de dominio público, que tienen como titular al Estado o a cualquier entidad pública que conforma el Sistema Nacional de Bienes Estatales, independientemente del nivel de gobierno al que pertenezcan, conforme se establezca en el Reglamento.

Policy: Ley de desarrollo forestal sustentable para el Estado de Baja California Sur.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley tiene por objeto propiciar la cultura forestal, regular y fomentar la conservación, protección, restauración, producción, ordenación, cultivo, manejo, así como el desarrollo tecnológico, la investigación forestal y el aprovechamiento sustentable de los ecosistemas forestales y los elementos que los conforman dentro del Estado de Baja California Sur.  El Título Segundo regula organización y administración del sector público forestall, regulando la distribución de competencias en materia forestall y favoreciendo la coordinación institucional. También regula los intrumentos de política forestal: a) la planeación del desarrollo forestal; b) el sistema estatal de información forestal; c) el inventario estatal forestal y de suelos; d) el ordenamiento forestal. El Título Cuarto está dedicado al manejo y aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos forestales, y establece disposiciones sobre las autorizaciones requeridas; los recursos forestales maderables ; las plantaciones forestales comerciales; el aprovechamiento de los recursos forestales no maderables; la colecta y uso de los recursos forestales. El Título Quinto tiene por objeto las medidas de  protección forestall, con especial atención a cuestiones de sanidad y a la prevención y combate de incendios forestales, además de las acciones de forestación y reforestación.

Policy: Law No. 13.361 establishing the State Technical Cadastre for Potentially Polluting Activities.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 19 articles and 2 Annexes, establishes the State Technical Cadastre for Potentially Polluting Activities and for other activities carried out by individuals or institutions, which need to use natural resources.  These activities include: extraction, production, transport and trade of any potentially products dangerous for the environments, as well as to products and sub-products originated from fauna and flora. This State Cadastre, regulated by the State Delegation of IBAMA, integrates the National System on Environmental Information established by Federal Law No. 6.938, and its amendments. The Annexes list all the potentially polluting activities and establish class, category and level of risk of these activities.

Policy: Order No. 348-p of the Minister of Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on inventory of emissions of greenhouse gases and ozone depleting substances.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of inventory of emissions of greenhouse gases and ozone depleting substances. Il s’agit d’une stratégie sectorielle d’une portée nationale qui vise à assurer, dans le cadre d’une gestion durable des ressources halieutiques, l’optimisation des bénéfices socio-économiques tirés du secteur, en termes de recettes budgétaires, de revenus des opérateurs privés, d’emplois, de sécurité alimentaire et de réduction de la pauvreté. Policy: Plan d’Action du Haut Commissariat aux Eaux et Forêts et à la Lutte Contre la Désertification.
Policy_Content: Le Plan d’action du Haut Commissariat aux Eaux et Forêts et à la Lutte Contre la Désertification (HCEFLCD) s’inscrit dans le cadre d’un programme décennal (2005-2014) qui consacre la multifonctionnalité des écosystèmes forestiers et vise (i) la lutte contre la désertification, (ii) la conservation et le développement des ressources forestières et (iii) le développement humain dans les espaces forestiers et péri-forestiers. La Plan d’Action se base sur neuf axes stratégiques correspondant à neuf programmes prioritaires, notamment: (1) la sécurisation et équipement du domaine forestier: garant du patrimoine et du droit d’usage; (2) la conservation et le développement des forêts: un programme central pour la reconstitution des écosystèmes; (3) la conservation des eaux et des sols: un contribution majeure à la lutte contre la désertification; (4) la prévention contre les incendies et la surveillance sanitaire: préoccupations permanentes pour la protection des forêts; (5) la conservation et la valorisation des aires protégées, des ressources cynégétiques et des poissons d’eau douce: garants de la gestion durable de la biodiversité, et un réseau international des réserves de biosphères de l’UNESCO comprenant des zones humides classées sites RAMSAR, des espaces naturels; l’arganeraie, les oasis du sud marocain et le Rif occidental. Ce dernier espace constitue la partie marocaine de la réserve de biosphère intercontinentale de la Méditerranée; (6) la valorisation des produits forestiers passe par l’organisation des usagers et la mise à niveau des filières; (7) la rationalisation de la gestion et optimisation des moyens; (8) la recherche forestière: outil stratégique pour améliorer la qualité des interventions; (9) amélioration du cadre législatif et réglementaire.

Policy: National Strategy on Gender Equality and Domestic Violence 2007-2010.
Policy_Content: The National Strategy on Gender Equality and Domestic Violence 2007-2010 is a multi-sectoral policy laying down the approaches and institutional mechanisms for mainstreaming gender issues into public policies, easing gender-based differences and preventing domestic violence. The country’s economic and social growth and the development and application of appropriate policies to achieve gender equality will serve as a premise for designing gender equality-related goals, and men and women’s equal access to decision-making at a central and local level, in the areas of education, health care, employment, public services and prevention of domestic violence.

Policy: National Action Programme for the Adaptation on Climate Change.
Policy_Content: National Action Programme for the Adaptation on Climate Change's primary sector is very relevant to poverty alleviation and the country’s economy given that the activities of the agriculture, livestock and fisheries sectors are essential, particularly to poor people. The primary sector guarantees food security of the diverse layers of the population, mainly the most vulnerable. Agro-silvo-pastoral activities are those that most contribute to the food security, with higher prominence for the two types of cropping (subsistence and rent). This situation is associated to the fact that a large proportion of the population depends on agriculture and livestock activities for their survival (pag. 9). the establishment of integrated protection systems that allow for a rational and sustainable exploration of water, soil and vegetation resources on the part of local farmers/raisers, has a capital importance role in reduction of vulnerability and the negative effects of climate change, having in account its contribution for the recharge of aquifers, soil protection, increase of firewood production and fodder, use of marginal lands for rain fed crops through adoption of agro-forestry systems and increase of agricultural productivity (pag. 29).

Policy: Regional Law No. 64-RZ “On regulation of forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates forest management for the purpose of timber extraction, procurement of non-timber forest products, edible forest products and collection of medicinal plants by citizens for personal needs, regulates forest management for hunting, and also exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts related to forest species. Citizens shall have the right to procure fuelwood and construction timber for personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract related to forest species (Art. 2). Rates of procurement of timber are set forth in the Art. 3. The modalities and rates of procurement of non-timber forest products are set forth in the Art. 4. The modalities of procurement of edible forest products and medicinal plants are set forth in the Art. 5. Plots of forestland allotted for hunting shall be considered hunting grounds. Natural and legal persons shall use plots of forestland for hunting in accordance with lease contract (Art. 7).

Policy: Regional Law No. 162-Z “On forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the rights and the duties of persons carrying out forest management for hunting purposes. Forest managers shall have the following rights: (a) to carry out biotechnical arrangements with a view to increase the number of wild fauna species; (b) to procure feed; (c) to improve forested land areas in accordance with forest plans; (d) to have access to information related to forest parcels conceded on lease for hunting management; and (e) keep and breed wild fauna species destined for hunting under semi-captive conditions (art. 1). Forest managers shall have the following duties: (a) use forest parcels allotted for hunting management in accordance with the acting legislation; (b) comply with terms and conditions of forest parcel lease contract; (c) carry out hunting management in accordance with forest development plan; (d) prevent environmental damages; (e) observe forest fire safety requirements; and (f) compensate damages caused to forestry by wild fauna species if their number exceeds the established limits (art. 2).

Policy: Land and Environment Court Rules 2007.
Policy_Content: These Rules, consisting of seven Parts and completed by one Schedule, prescribe the general practice applicable to all proceedings to be commenced in the Land and Environment Court. They are divided into 6 Parts. Part 2 concerns the administration. In particular, it deals with the following matters: seal of the court, sittings of the court, vacation, registry, judges and assessors. Part 3 applies to proceedings in Class 1, 2 or 3 of the Court's jurisdiction. It regulates: The originating process, Where reference to other body required; Parties to appeals under the Environmental Planning and Assessment Act 1979; Public authority to make documents available; Costs in certain proceedings; Neutral evaluation, a process of evaluation of a dispute in which the evaluator seeks to identify and reduce the issues of fact and law in dispute, including by assessing the relative strengths and weaknesses of each party's case and offering an opinion as to the likely outcome of the proceedings; and Court functions not exercisable by Commissioners. Part 4 applies to proceedings in Class 4 of the Court's jurisdiction and regulates: Proceedings brought in the public interest; Proceedings for the review of public authority's decision; and Neutral evaluation. Part5 applies to proceedings in Class 5, 6 or 7 of the Court's jurisdiction.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Tsawwassen First Nation Final Agreement.
Policy_Content: This comprehensive Agreement is a Treaty and a Land Claims Agreement within the meaning of sections 25 and 35 of the Constitution Act, 1982. It exhaustively sets out the rights of Tsawwassen First Nation, their attributes, the geographic extent of those rights, and the limitations to those rights to which the Parties have agreed, i.e.: a) the aboriginal rights, including aboriginal title, modified as a result of this Agreement, in Canada, of Tsawwassen First Nation in and to Tsawwassen Lands and other lands and resources in Canada; b) the jurisdictions, authorities and rights of Tsawwassen Government.The Treaty addresses direct control and ownership of land, including fishing and hunting rights; self governance comprising laws relating to governance, natural resources, land management, and social programming; the right to harvest wildlife, migratory birds, and plants for food, control of national and provincial parks; ownership of all subsurface resources such as gravel, sand, minerals and petroleum; the right to catch fish, crab, and harvest water plants for food, including an  allocation of Fraser River salmon.

Policy: National Adaptation Programme of Action (NAPA), December 2007.
Policy_Content: The National Adaptation Programme of Action (NAPA) includes summaries of 4 initiatives, for various economic and social development sectors, with special emphasis on the prevention of natural disasters and Alert and Early Warning Systems; the agricultural, fisheries, energy, environmental and water sectors; coastal zones; and erosion control. The purpose of the NAPA is to present the immediate and urgent needs of the country that have been identified during the participatory evaluation process, for the purposes of strengthening national capacity to cope with the adverse effects of climate change. This will be accomplished by meeting the following objectives: 1. Strengthen the early warning system in the country; 2. Strengthen the capacities of family farmers to dealing with the adverse effects of climate change; 3. Improve the knowledge and strengthen the management of river waters; 4. Promote actions to limit erosion and to develop sustainable fishery activities; 5. Promote actions that will contribute to the mitigation of Greenhouse Gases (GHG); 6. Promote public education activities and information dissemination on climate change; 7. Improve the coordination between the various groups that work on issues related to the evaluation of climate change vulnerabilities and hazard risk reduction; 8. Promote the integration of climate change into decentralized district planning (pag. 3).

Policy: Order No. 319 validating the Regulation on competence of the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service in the sphere of supervision over exploration, rational management and protection of subsoil.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes competence of the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service related to supervision over exploration, rational management and protection of subsoil that shall be carried out in the form of inspection by the authorized bodies. The purpose of the foresaid inspection shall be the enforcement of legislation related to subsoil management and protection. The objectives of inspection shall be: (a) compliance with legislative requirements on subsoil; (b) compliance with licensing terms and conditions for subsoil management; (c) availability of technical mining schemes; (d) reliability of data on state and change of mineral deposits; and (e) reliability of data related to payment of environmental fees. Inspection report shall contain information on detected offences and offenders.

Policy: Regional Law No. 703 “On validation of modalities and rates of timber extraction for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that persons in need of timber for individual personal needs must submit application to the authorized state regional forest institution for timber destined for the following purposes: (a) construction; (b) heating; and (c) for other individual personal needs. In the application citizens must specify the exact purpose and the requested amount. The authorized institution shall make decision within 15 working days since submittal of the application. In accordance with the aforesaid decision the authorized institution shall conclude with the citizen contract for purchase and sale of forest species. Rates of allotment of timber shall be established as follows: (a) for housing construction – 300 cubic metres once in 25 years; (b) for heating 0,4 cubic metres per 1 cubic metre of total area once a year; and (c) for other individual personal needs up to 10 cubic metres once a year per each owner of an edifice.

Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for individual housing construction – up to 125 cubic metres once in twenty-five years; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 25 cubic metres once in five years per family; (c) fuelwood for heating – up to 10 cubic metres annually; (d) up to 2 cubic metres of timber once in three years for other individual personal needs. Regional authorities shall establish annually total allowable standing timber for timber extraction.

Policy: Ley de desarrollo forestal sustentable del Estado de Morelos.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley reconoce que los bosques y selvas, independientemente de su titularidad, desempeñan una función social relevante, tanto como fuente de recursos naturales como por ser proveedores de múltiples servicios ambientales, entre ellos, de protección del suelo y del ciclo hidrológico; de fijación del carbono atmosférico; de depósito de la diversidad biológica y como elementos fundamentales del paisaje. En este sentido la Ley establece normas que garanticen la conservación y protección de los recursos forestales en el Estado de Morelos, promoviendo su restauración, mejora, sustentabilidad, aprovechamiento racional, el fomento al desarrollo en investigación y asesoría y gestión forestal, apoyándose en la solidaridad colectiva y la cohesión territorial, así como distribuir las competencias que en materia forestal correspondan al gobierno estatal y los gobiernos municipales. La Ley se aplica a todos los terrenos forestales, independientemente de su régimen de propiedad o tenencia. Entre los principio rectores de la Ley cabe mencionar los siguientes : a) la gestión sostenible de los recursos forestales; b) el cumplimiento equilibrado de la multifuncionalidad de los recursos forestales en sus valores ambientales, económicos y sociales; c) la planificación forestal en el marco de la ordenación del territorio; d) el fomento de las producciones forestales y sus sectores económicos asociados; e) la creación de empleo y el desarrollo del medio rural ; f) la conservación y restauración de la biodiversidad de los ecosistemas forestales; g) la integración en la política forestal nacional de los objetivos de la acción internacional sobre protección del medio ambiente, especialmente en materia de desertificación, cambio climático y biodiversidad; h) la precaución ; i) la adaptación de los bosques y selvas al cambio climático, fomentando una gestión encaminada a la resistencia de los bosques y selvas al mismo.

Policy: Sea Pollution (Prevention of Oil Pollution) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 788 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations give effect to Annex I of the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships as amended. The Regulations apply to all Irish ships wherever they may be and to all other ships when they are in the territorial waters of the State. The Regulations prohibit and control discharge into the sea of oil and oily mixtures. They require ships to follow specified procedures when washing cargo tanks. Ballasting arrangements and the discharge of ballast water are also controlled. The Regulations also provide for adequate facilities at ports and terminals for the reception of oil and oily mixtures. Ships are required to be surveyed for the purposes of the Regulations and to carry an International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate. Ships are also required to carry an Operations and Equipment Manual, an Oil Record Book and a shipboard oil pollution emergency plan approved by the Minister. Section 29 of the Sea Pollution Act, 1991 provides for penalties for breaches of these Regulations.

Policy: Order No. 310 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on state registration of the plots of forest land within state forest fund.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that state registration of the plots of forest land within state forest fund shall be carried out by state executive bodies responsible for keeping state forest register. State registration shall be carried out in the following cases: (a) allotment of the plots of forest land within state forest fund; and (b) renewal of lease contracts for the plots of forest land and renewal of free of charge forest management contracts in case of conformation thereof to the Forest Code. The forest managers concerned shall submit to the registration authority the following information and data: (a) project documentation specifying location, qualitative and quantitative characteristics of the plots of forest land; (b) name of region, municipal unit, forest park, forestry and inventory plot; (c) forest area; (d) description of forest vegetation, age and amount of forest stock; (e) purposeful use and protection category of forests; (f) authorized forest uses; and (g) map.

Policy: Regional Law No. 118-ZKO “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates organization, conservation and management of protected areas with a view of conservation of unique and typical ecosystems, wild fauna and wild flora species, genetic fund, study of natural processes in the biosphere and supervision over change of the state thereof and ecological education of the population. It classifies protected areas as follows: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; and (e) healthcare areas and spas. Boundaries of protected areas shall be taken into consideration in the projecting of economic activities that can have environmental impact. Protected areas shall be constituted in accordance with plans and schemes of development and distribution of protected areas in accordance with proposals by local government, legal and natural persons , and citizens' associations. Regulation on regional and local protected areas must contain the following information and data: (a) name, location, boundaries; (b) period of functioning and type; (c) land area and categories of land included; (d) description of environmental particulars and management regime; and (e) cartographic materials.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Creation and Management of Protected Areas of Imereti Caves (No. 5485-IIS of 2007)
Policy_Content: This Law creates and provides for the management of the protected areas of Imereti caves. It consists of six chapters: General provisions (I); Location, surface area and boundaries of the protected areas of Imereti caves (II); Territorial-functional organization of the protected areas of Imereti caves (III); Management of the protected areas of Imereti caves (IV); Financing of the protected areas of Imereti caves (V); and Transitional provisions and final provisions (VI). The objectives of the Law include protection, restoration and maintenance of natural cultural environment, unique and rare organic and non-organic natural formations, archaeological complexes, and rare monuments of nature; supporting recreation and tourism in the natural and historical-cultural environment; ensuring care, protection and restoration of soil, water, fauna, flora (including forests) and other natural resources; and creating favorable conditions and monitoring education and resource activities for protection and restoration of monuments of nature.

Policy: Regional Law No. 691 “On the modalities of procurement of edible forest resources, collection and harvesting of medicinal plants and collection of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of procurement of edible forest resources, collection and harvesting of medicinal plants and collection of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs. Citizens carrying out the aforesaid activities must observe forest fire safety rules, sanitary rules and regulations, reforestation and care of forests rules and regulations. Collection of berries shall be authorized in the period of mass ripening thereof. Collection of mushrooms must ensure reproduction thereof. Collection of birch juice must ensure conservation of birch timber. Collection of fuelwood shall be authorized all the year round. Wood forage shall be collected from cut timber.

Policy: Ley de promoción y fomento minero para el Estado de Sonora.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto promover y fomentar el desarrollo del sector minero en el Estado de Sonora. Sus objetivos específicos incluyen: promover la creación de condiciones económicas e infraestructura para atraer al Estado inversiones que favorezcan el crecimiento del sector minero, sobre bases de desarrollo equilibrado y sustentable; fomentar e incentivar el aprovechamiento de los recursos minerales de la Entidad; impulsar el mejoramiento del marco jurídico estatal que favorezca e impulse el crecimiento económico; promover el desarrollo de la investigación científica y tecnológica en materia que favorezca el fortalecimiento económico, el desarrollo social y la productividad; crear programas para el fomento de la minería, que consideren prioritario el fomento de la pequeña y mediana minería. Para el financiamiento de las actividades de promoción y fomento minero en el Estado, operará el Fondo Estatal de Promoción y Fomento Minero. En cuanto al marco institucional, la Ley crea el Consejo de Minería del Estado de Sonora, con la finalidad de hacer partícipes a los representantes del sector privado y académicos en el desarrollo de los sectores mineros sonorenses, mediante propuestas de políticas de promoción y fomento minero y coadyuvar en la planeación, coordinación y evaluación de las mismas.

Policy: Loi n° 026-2007/AN du 20 novembre 2007 instituant un contrôle des engrais au Burkina Faso.
Policy_Content: Il est institué un contrôle des engrais d’importation, d’exportation et de fabrication locale au Burkina Faso. L’importation des engrais sur le territoire du Burkina Faso est soumise à l’obtention d’un Certificat national de conformité (CNC), délivré par le ministère en charge du commerce, après avis du ministre en charge de l’agriculture. L’importation  et la commercialisation des engrais sont soumises à l’obtention d’un agrément délivré par le ministre en charge du commerce, après avis du ministre en charge de l’agriculture. Tout emballage contenant de l’engrais comporte une étiquette appropriée présentant d’une manière lisible le nom et l’adresse du fabriquant, la formule, la teneur en éléments nutritifs et le poids net.

Policy: Regional Law No. 486-Z “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that forest management can be carried out with or without allotment of forest parcels, with or without expropriation of forest resources. Management of forest parcels pertaining to public forest shall require payment of fees. Forest declaration stating use of forests shall be submitted annually to state bodies. Forest management and, in particular, timber extraction, can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Forest Code. Citizens shall be granted the right to carry out timber extraction for individual personal needs, including fuelwood for heating and building timber for housing construction and repairs in accordance with purchase and sale contract for forest species, without allotment of forest parcels. Citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources free of charge for individual personal needs.
