Policy: Plant Protection Law.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to regulate the relations between the state, citizens and legal entities in connection with the protection of pastures and plant varieties of agricultural crops against plant diseases, pest infestation, rodents, and weeds, and also application of quarantine and performance of control activities. Plant protection shall be intended a complex activity to implement measures to prevent, combat, and control of pastoral and cultivated plants from plant diseases, pest infestation, rodents and weeds. Preventive measures shall include detection of the presence of infectious disease, pest infestation, rodents and weeds, and the reduction of infected areas, assessment of causes, extent and degree of infecting and spreading of infectious diseases. Counteraction shall include measures to eliminate spreading and extinction of plant diseases, pest infestation, rodents and weeds, destruction of the foci and restoration of ecological balance. Scientific research institutions shall conduct studies, experiments and testing on plant diseases, pest infestation, rodents, weeds and extinction, assessing results and elaborating plant protection techniques. Natural persons and legal entities shall be granted the following rights: (a) to obtain information related to plant protection from public institutions and organizations; and (b) to select professional organization to perform plant protection activities. Natural persons and legal entities shall have the following duties: (a) to undertake immediate measure for the prevention of spreading of plant diseases, pests, rodents and weeds in case of detection thereof on their property; and (b) to obtain from local authority certificate of origin of plant varieties and derivatives thereof for transportation and trade of plants. This Law consists of VII Chapters divided into 17 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II specifies plant protection arrangements. Chapter III establishes competence of public authorities in the field of plant protection. Chapter IV establishes rights and duties of natural persons and legal entities in the field of plant protection. Chapter V regards phytosanitary arrangements. Chapter VI regards arrangements for conservation of plant varieties. Chapter VII contains miscellaneous provisions.

Policy: Law on Circulation of Genetically Modified Organisms (2007)
Policy_Content: The Law determines principles for circulation of genetically modified organisms in Latvia. Its purpose is to achieve high level of safety in all stages of circulation of genetically modified organisms in order to prevent the negative impact on human and animal health or the environment, to preserve biological diversity, to promote the development of sustainable agriculture and biotechnology, as well as the co-existence of genetically modified crops concurrently with organic and conventional farming. The Law prescribes the competence of State authorities, the rights and duties of natural and legal persons, the principles, supervision and control for the circulation of genetically modified organisms including those for co-existence of modified crops, public participation, liability and legal protection of persons, as well as security measures and circulation of information for the prevention of any possible emergency situation.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants

Policy: Ordonnance sur la coordination des inspections dans les exploitations agricoles (Ordonnance sur la coordination des inspections, OCI).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance règle la coordination des inspections dans les exploitations agricoles. L’article 2 établit que les cantons coordonnent les inspections de telle manière que les exploitations agricoles ne soient, en principe, pas inspectées plus d’une fois par an, et les exploitations biologiques pas plus de deux fois par an. Il peut être procédé à des inspections plus fréquentes en particulier dans les situations suivantes: a) dans les exploitations dans lesquelles des lacunes ont été constatées lors de l’inspection précédente; b) dans les exploitations à propos desquelles il existe un soupçon justifié de non-respect des prescriptions; c) dans les exploitations dans lesquelles des changements importants ont eu lieu; d) en raison d’événements extraordinaires, comme des maladies ou des épizooties. Le texte comprend 7 articles e 1 annexe.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ordonnance sur la vulgarisation agricole et la vulgarisation en économie familiale rurale (Ordonnance sur la vulgarisation agricole).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance régit: a) les objectifs et les tâches: 1) des centrales de vulgarisation, 2) des services cantonaux de vulgarisation, 3) des services de vulgarisation d’organisations ou d’institutions actives au niveau interrégional ou national dans des domaines particuliers (services de vulgarisation des organisations); b) les exigences minimales auxquelles doivent satisfaire les centrales de vulgarisation, les services de vulgarisation des organisations et le personnel professionnel de ces institutions; c) l’aide financière que la Confédération accorde aux centrales de vulgarisation et aux services de vulgarisation des organisations; d) l’aide financière que la Confédération accorde aux groupes d’intérêt ou aux organisations pour leur encadrement professionnel lors de l’étude préliminaire de leurs projets collectifs. La section 2 établit que la vulgarisation soutient les personnes dans leurs efforts visant à: a) produire des denrées alimentaires saines et de haute qualité; b) être concurrentielles et à s’adapter au marché; c) préserver les ressources naturelles et le paysage; d) jouer un rôle actif dans le développement de l’espace rural; e) promouvoir la qualité de vie et la situation sociale des familles paysannes. Le texte comprend 12 articles répartis en 5 sections comme suit: Objet et champ d’application (1); Buts et tâches de la vulgarisation (2); Exigences minimales (3); Aides financières (4); Dispositions finales (5).

Policy: Environmental Liability Act (2007)
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the prevention and remedying of damage caused to the environment based on the polluter pays principle. This Act applies to environmental damage or threat of environmental damage caused by non-point pollution if it is possible to determine a causal link between the environmental damage or a threat thereof and a person’s or persons’ act or omission. This Act applies to environmental damage or threat of environmental damage arising from an event, act or omission occurring after the entry into force of this Act if not more than 30 years have passed from the event, act or omission that caused it.

Policy: Regional Law No. 146-OZ “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs without tender in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. Re-sale of timber to third party shall be prohibited. Application for conclusion of purchase and sale contract of forest species shall be submitted to the authorized state forest institution (art. 1). Timber extraction shall be carried out in the form of final felling and selection felling (art. 2). Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for housing construction – up to 150 cubic metres once in 50 years; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 30 cubic metres once in 10 years; (c) for construction of dependency outbuilding – up to 25 cubic metres once in 30 years; and (d) fuelwood for heating – up to 30 cubic metres annually (art. 3).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 159 “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species for residential housing construction and heating. Timber extraction and logging shall be carried out within the period of validity of purchase and sale contract of forest species. In the process of timber extraction for individual personal needs citizens must: (a) comply with terms and conditions envisaged by purchase and sale contract of forest species; (b) prevent negative environmental impact; (c) prevent damage and destruction of precious tree species; (d) preserve trees that are not subject to felling; (e) carry out land clearing after felling; (f) not to leave uncut and holding wood; (g) conserve forestry marks; and (h) prevent leaving stumps higher than one third of diameter of severing cut.

Policy: National Policy for Technical Assistance and Rural Extension.
Policy_Content: 3.1. The principles of National Policy of National Policy for Technical Assistance and Rural Extension (ATER) are the following: to ensure for family farmers, settled by agrarian reform programs, indigenous, quilombolas, aquaculture fishermen, forest peoples, rubber tappers and other specific beneficiaries of programs MDA/SAF, access to free technical service and public extension for improving family farming. To promote the sustainable rural development, focusing on endogenous development processes, supporting family farmers in enhancing the sustainable use of natural resources. To adopt a multidisciplinary approach, encouraging the adoption of new participatory approaches and a technological principles of agro-ecology. To establish a management method capable of democratizing decisions, contributing to the construction of citizenship and facilitate the process of social control in planning, monitoring and evaluation of activities. TO develop permanent educational processes aimed at skills training, improving the quality of life and promoting rural sustainable development. 3.2. The guidelines of the National Policy are: to support multiple and coordinated actions of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension, enabling equitable economic development and solidarity, in communities and rural areas, taking into account the environmental dimension. To ensure the permanent supply of ATER services that are present and active in all Brazilian rural areas in order to meet the demands of all farmers in the country. To support actions to improve skills and increase agricultural and fisheries production with emphasis on basic food production. To ensure all stages of economic activities, from production to marketing and supply, observing the peculiarities of the different production chains. To prioritise Committes as active fora and co-responsible for the management of the National Policy at the municipal, state and federal level in order to strengthen the participation of beneficiaries.

Policy: Fiji Forest Policy Statement.
Policy_Content: The sectoral nation-wide Fiji Forest Policy Statement was adopted in November 2007 by the Cabinet of the Republic of Fiji Islands. The Policy’s goal is sustainable management of Fiji’s forests to maintain their natural potential and to achieve greater social, economic and environmental benefits for current and future generations. Therefore, its objectives include: ensured ecosystem stability through conservation of forest biodiversity, water catchments and soil fertility; ensured sustainable supply of forest products and services by maintaining a sufficiently large permanent forest area under efficient and effective management; increased engagement by landowners and communities in sustainable forest management and an equitable distribution of benefits from forest products and processes including ensured protection of intellectual property rights; increased employment in the forestry sector, sufficient supply of domestic markets and increased foreign exchange earnings through sustainable forest-based industry development and trade; and enhanced national capacity to manage and develop the forest sector in a collaborative approach with involvement of all stakeholders.

Policy: National Integrated Water Resources Management Policy.
Policy_Content: The Integrated Water Resources Management Policy promotes a new integrated approach to manage the water resources in ways that are sustainable and most beneficial to the people. This approach is based on the continued recognition of the social value of water, while at the same time giving due attention to its economic value. The overall goal is to use the principle of Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM) and adopt a strategy to achieve the vision of development efficiency and effectively manage a system for the sustainable development of water resources in Liberia: (i) to ensure full socio-economic benefits for present and future generations; (ii) to ensure access to safe and adequate water for people (i.e. domestic water supply); (iii) to ensure the availability of adequate quantity and quality of water for the environment and ecology; (iv) to ensure the availability of sufficient quantity and quality water for food security; (v) to ensure availability of water for other uses (i.e. hydropower generation, industrial use, water transport, recreation and firefighting).

Policy: Estrategia Española de Desarrollo Sostenible 2007.
Policy_Content: La Estrategia Española de Desarrollo Sostenible 2007 (EEDS) tiene un planteamiento acorde con la visión estratégica de la Unión Europea (UE) que fomenta un enfoque integrador de la dimensión económica, social, ambiental y global de la sostenibilidad del desarrollo con los objetivos de: garantizar la prosperidad económica, asegurar la protección del medio ambiente, evitar la degradación del capital natural, fomentar una mayor cohesión social y contribuir solidariamente al desarrollo de los países menos favorecidos en aras de la sostenibilidad global. Esta EEDS se centra en la dimensión medioambiental, social y global de la sostenibilidad, y aborda todas las prioridades definidas en la Estrategia Europea distribuidas en tres dimensiones: I) La sostenibilidad ambiental, dirigida a la protección de la atmósfera, calidad del aire, agua, suelo, naturaleza y salud, se desarrolla en tres secciones interrelacionadas: producción y consumo; cambio climático; y conservación, gestión de los recursos naturales y ocupación del territorio (recursos hídricos, biodiversidad, usos del suelo). II) La sostenibilidad social, que desarrolla otros dos aspectos fundamentales, por una parte, el empleo, la cohesión social y la pobreza y, por otra parte, la salud pública y la dependencia; conjuganso crecimiento económico con bienestar social. III) La sostenibilidad global, que analiza el papel fundamental que juega España en materia de cooperación internacional para el desarrollo sostenible. Asimismo, es necesario considerar la perspectiva de género que tiene un carácter transversal en la EEDS. La EEDS contiene una serie de objetivos principales que orientan en cada sección el tipo de medidas que se deben llevar a cabo.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2646-III “On forest management for hunting”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the rules of hunting management on forest parcels. Forest parcels conceded for hunting management shall be considered hunting grounds. Forest managers shall have the right: (a) carry out biotechnical arrangements;  (b) keep wild fauna species in semi-captive conditions in accordance with acting legislation; and (d) procure fuelwood for heating of hunting lodges and making fires. Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of procurements of edible non-timber forest products and collection of medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs. Non-timber edible forest products shall be considered wild growing fruits, berries, nuts, mushrooms, forestry seeds, woody juices. Procurement of the aforesaid resources by citizens in forests shall be free of charge. Stay of citizens in forests can be restricted or prohibited due to forest fire risks. Procurement of woody juices shall be authorized from trees with diameter of no less than 20 cm at the height of 1,3m. Procurement of fruits and nuts shall be authorized exclusively from standing trees and shrubbery.

Policy: Ley Nº 3.762 – Declara al Río Camacho, y sus afluentes, Zona de Protección Ambiental, siendo de prioridad nacional y departamental la conservación y protección ambiental, paisajística y del ecosistema.
Policy_Content: De conformidad con lo establecido en la Ley del Medio Ambiente, por la presente Ley se declara al Río Camacho y a sus afluentes Zona de Protección Ambiental, y se dispone que será de prioridad nacional y departamental la conservación y protección ambiental, paisajística y del ecosistema. Se establecen en consecuencia las correspondientes disposiciones en materia minera. En primer lugar queda prohibida la explotación de áridos y materiales de construcción en el Río Camacho y sus afluentes, desde sus nacientes o cabecera de cuenca hasta su desemboque o unión al Río Guadalquivir en el Departamento de Tarija, para proteger y conservar la flora y fauna ictícola de esta cuenca y evitar el deterioro ambiental, de la biodiversidad y paisajístico de la indicada cuenca. Las autoridades Prefecturales y Municipales, deben implementar medidas de mitigación y restauración de las áreas degradadas o alteradas con el fin de proteger las zonas productivas de la cuenca del Río Camacho a corto plazo y su expansión y fortalecimiento productivo en el largo plazo. En segundo lugar, todas las concesiones mineras que hubiesen sido otorgadas antes de la promulgación de esta Ley deben ser sometidas a una evaluación por parte de la Autoridad Ambiental Departamental conjuntamente con los Municipios involucrados en la cuenca del Río Camacho y sus afluentes.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No. 131-GD “On regulation of forest relations”.

Priority timber extraction shall concern destroyed, damaged and overmature forest species. Allocation of forest stand for timber extraction to citizens shall be performed by local government within the limits of timber extraction quotas. Excess of maximum allowable limit for timber extraction shall be prohibited. Timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs shall be regulated by purchase and sale contract of forest species.

Policy: Regional Law No. 163-OZ ““On modalities of procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources, edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of edible non-timber forest resources and medicinal plants free of charge and without any special permit or authorization and without allotment of forest parcels. Stay of citizens in forests can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Forest Code. Procurement and harvesting of mushrooms and wild growing plants recorded in the Red Book of rare and endangered species shall be prohibited. Procurement of the edible forest resources and medicinal plants shall be carried out in accordance with forestry regulations of forest districts and forest parks and it shall be carried out manually, without any mechanical means so as to ensure inexhaustible management and reproduction thereof. Procurement of wood juices shall be carried out in forest parcels of mature forest.

Policy: Regional Law No. 290-Z “On subsoil management for mining and extraction of common widespread minerals of local significance”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of subsoil management, concession of plots of subsoil of local significance containing common widespread minerals and also plots of subsoil destined for construction of exploration and mining facilities. Plots of subsoil shall be conceded in the form of mining allotment or geological allotment. Subsoil management shall be subject to mandatory public licensing. Subsoil management licence holder shall have exclusive right to subsoil management within the boundaries of allotted plot of subsoil. Period of subsoil management can be either open-ended or for a limited period of time. Exploration licences shall have the period of validity 5 years, for mining and extraction of common widespread minerals until complete exhaustion of mineral deposits and short-term mining licence shall have the period of validity up to one year.

Policy: Ley Nº 7.838 - Programa de Forestación de la Provincia de San Juan.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se establece el Programa de Forestación de la Provincia de San Juan, con el fin de fomentar la forestación en todo el territorio provincial y recuperar el bosque nativo, a fin de resguardar los ecosistemas provinciales de todos los procesos de desertificación ocasionados por la acción del hombre. La Ley define el marco institucional competente, el cual incluye el Consejo Público del Arbolado Público y Forestación. Entre las medidas de protección forestal previstas, cabe destacar la prohibición de la tala y la erradicación en verde, el mochado o cualquier actividad humana que dañe al arbolado público, así como la prohibición del desmonte o extracción de ejemplares de especies en verde de la flora autóctona o bosque nativo.

Policy: Regional Law No. 143-Z “On modalities and rates of timber extraction, procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest resources and collection of medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall be granted the right for timber extraction for individual personal needs for heating, construction, repairs of housing facilities and outbuildings. The allowed amount of timber extraction of the aforesaid purposes shall be set annually by the authorized state regional institution in the sphere of forest management. Timber extraction shall be carried out in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. Procurement of non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources, and collection of medicinal plants shall be carried out during calendar year shall be subject to ripening period of the aforesaid forest species.

Policy: Regional Law No. 472-z “On agricultural development”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be regulation of the relations in the sphere of agricultural development with a view of sustainable development thereof. The principal tasks of the regional agrarian policy shall be as follows: (a) improvement of competitiveness of the regional agricultural commodities and the regional producers thereof; (b) stable and sustainable development of rural areas; (c) conservation and reproduction of natural resources required for agricultural production; and (d) control of agricultural commodities price indices. The main directions of the regional agrarian policy shall be as follows: (a) stable provision of the population with the national agricultural commodities; (b) support of agricultural producers; (c) stable development of rural areas; and (d) improvement of training of specialists for agriculture.

Policy: Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development No. 129 of 2007 (X. 31.) FVM on certain issues related to the regulation of natural sweetener products.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development regulates certain issues related to the regulation of natural sweetener products. The quota for beet sugar and isoglucose allocated to Hungary is set out in Annex III to Council Regulation set out in Annex II to this Decision. The allocation of the national quota among quota holders is set out in Section 1. The licence holder may have a quota within the limits set by this Regulation and Community legislation. Following the decision of the European Commission on the reduction of quotas under Article 19 of the Council Regulation, the Minister shall reduce the quota available to the licence holders in proportion to the basic quotas. The powers conferred on Member States by Article 11 of the Council Regulation on the redistribution of national quotas are exercised by the Minister. In the event of termination of the quota licence holder without successor, it will be established a temporary scheme for the restructuring of the sugar industry in the Community and the common agricultural policy.

Policy: Policies and Strategies on Promoting Women’s Health.
Policy_Content: The Act, which consists of 4 articles, regulates provisions to promote women’s health condition and guarantee their access to comprehensive healthcare. The main objectives of the Act include improvement of the women’s health in various physical, psychological and social aspects, disease prevention, reduction of risk factors, improve the policies of the Ministry of Health regarding women’s health, increase the community awareness, increase in women’s access to information and strengthening the central role of women in insuring the health conditions of families and society. Assessment and frequent supervision on implementation of the regulations and programs regarding women’s health, increase the cooperation between different relevant departments, continuous evaluation of the women’s health condition in the country, develop educational programs proportionate to the women’s requirements, modify the societies’ beliefs concerning the women’s position in decision making, support relevant NGO’s, increase job opportunities for  women and  reform the rules and regulations pertaining to women are other duties of this Act.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Southern Asia

Policy: Growth and Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper.
Policy_Content: The Growth and Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (Strategy) is a cross-sectoral strategy with national coverage that entered into force in 2008 and was implemented until 2010. The Strategy articulates the vision and resources required to lift Haiti out of poverty and destitution, and it has the following priority pillars: growth vectors, human development, and democratic governance. These three pillars are supported by twelve targeted or cross- cutting thematic areas, namely: gender equity; human rights; the environment; disaster and risk management; combating HIV/AIDS; scientific and technological innovation; childhood poverty; youth employment; local border development; and capacity-building.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Presidential Decree on measures to improve the land reclamation system.
Policy_Content: This Decree has the following purposes: (a) promote the sustainable development of agriculture; (b) improve reclaimed land, soil fertility and yield of agricultural crops; and (c) the efficient organization of land reclamation processes. It mandates: (a) improvement of the functioning and maintenance land reclamation systems to effective drainage of effluent; and (b) introduction of large-scale leases for land reclamation equipment to be used by water management organizations and water users’ associations. The Decree further requires the establishment of a fund to improve the land reclamation system by: (a) accumulating assets for land reclamation; (b) elaborating long-term and medium-term state programmes of land reclamation; and (c) providing state support to agricultural producers to finance soil fertility measures through improved land reclamation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy: Government Decree No. 284 of 2007 (X. 29.) on certain rules for protection against environmental noise and vibration.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, with the exceptions in paragraph (2), regulates activities and facilities that cause or cause environmental noise or vibration. This Regulation shall not apply to the following activities: (a) occasional events held exclusively in public areas; (b) occupational noise and vibration at work; (c) activities which meet the household needs of individuals; (d) noise and vibration within transport vehicles; (e) noise and vibration caused by health rescue, fire-fighting, technical rescue; (f) religious activities; (g) events covered by the Law on Assembly Rights. It establishes that is forbidden to cause ambient noise or vibration in the environment to be protected. Extra emission or load limit values ​​shall be considered significant as specified in separate legislation on noise and vibration loading limits. In order to control noise protection requirements, the environmental protection authority designated in Section 4 may carry out controls or perform measurements, calculations, tests or require the operator of the noise source to perform measurements and calculations.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Resolution No. 233/T of 28 October 2007 issuing the Implementing Regulation for the Legislative Decree No. 25 of 2007 on forests.
Policy_Content: This Implementing Regulation is composed of 21 articles. Article 1 gives terms and definitions. Article 2 defines conditions and requirements for the extraction, gaining and recovery of forest products. Articles 3 and 4 specify instructions, procedures and measures for the transportation, storage and trade of forest products. Article 5 deals with requirements and conditions for the issuance of licences for the importation and exportation of forest products. Article 6 pertains to procedures and requirements for the establishment of sawmills and grinders of firewood and timber. Articles 7 and 8 provide for instructions and procedures for the use, exploitation and benefit of the State forests. Articles 9 and 10 concern licences for the transformation of firewood of fruit trees and timber in coals. Article 11 defines procedures and measures for burning grasses, herbages, thorns and spikes close to forests. Article 12 defines requirements and conditions for the establishment of un-harmful and un-dangerous industrial installations in forests. Article 13 defines requirements and conditions for the establishment of aerials and antennas. Article 15 contains requirements and conditions for uprooting and cutting of forest trees. Articles 16 and 17 concern licences for land reclamation and reform covered by forests. Articles 19 and 20 define fees for services offered by the State and compensations for damaged plants and crops.
Subject: Forestry

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée une unité de police de lutte contre la pollution des milieux récepteurs (sol, eau, air) dénommée UNIPOL. L'UNIPOL est intégré au Centre Ivoirien Anti-pollution (CIAPOL) qui en assure la direction, la gestion et l'organisation. L’UNIPOL a pour missions de rechercher, de constater et de réprimer les infractions à la législation sur la pollution des milieux récepteurs, notamment: Rejet ou déversement d’hydrocarbures, de substances ou de produits dangereux ou nocifs par des navires, des embarcations, des engins flottants et fixes; Contrôle des mouvements transfrontaliers de déchets par mer; Incinération non autorisée en mer et en lagune; Immersion non autorisée des déchets; Pêche avec des produits chimiques et des substances nocives; Rejet d’origine industriel, artisanal et agricole; Pollution des Eaux Continentales; Pollution par le rejet ou le déversement de produits phytosanitaires ; Rejet des eaux usées industrielles; Pollution du sol; Pollution atmosphérique.

Policy: Loi n° l/2006/010/an Relative a la Lutte contre le blanchiment des capitaux en République de Guinée.
Policy_Content: La  présente  loi  a  pour  objet  de  définir  le  cadre  juridique  relatif  à  la  lutte  contre  le blanchiment  de  capitaux,  afin  de  prévenir  l’utilisation  des  circuits  économiques financiers, bancaires et non financiers guinéens à des fins de recyclage de capitaux ou de tous autres biens d’origine illicite. La loi est composée par 6 titres, à savoir: definitions (titre préliminaire); dispositions générales (I); de la prévention du blanchiment de capital (II); de la detection du blanchiment de capital (III); des mesures coercitives (IV); de la cooperation internationale (V); et disposition finales (VI). Les dispositions des titres II et III de la loi sont applicables à toute personne physique ou morale qui, dans le cadre de sa profession, réalise, contrôle ou conseille des opérations entraînant des dépôts, des échanges, des placements, des conversions ou tous autres mouvements de capitaux ou de tous autres biens, à savoir: a) le Trésor public ; b) la BCRG; c) les organismes financiers; et d) les entreprises et professions non financières.

Policy: Directive 2007/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the assessment and management of flood risks.
Policy_Content: This Directive sets out measures to reduce the risk of adverse effects associated with floods, with a view to protecting human health, the environment, cultural heritage and economic activities in general. It establishes a framework concerning the management and assessment of such flood risks. According to these provisions, all Member States must (i) undertake a preliminary flood risk assessment for each river basin district and for coastal areas; (ii) prepare flood hazard maps and flood risk maps; and (iii) elaborate flood risk management plans. These provisions must be implemented by Member States in coordination with the application of Directive 2000/60/EC, particularly as regards the objectives specified in article 4.

Se considera núcleo agricultor familiar a una persona o grupo de personas, parientes o no, que habitan bajo un mismo techo en un régimen de tipo familiar. Policy: Ley Nº 26/2007 - Ley de Responsabilidad Medioambiental. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Responsabilidad Medioambiental regula la responsabilidad de los operadores de prevenir, evitar y reparar los daños medioambientales, de conformidad con el Artículo 45 de la Constitución y con los principios de prevención y de que «quien contamina paga». Esta Ley se aplicará a los daños medioambientales y a las amenazas inminentes de que tales daños ocurran, cuando hayan sido causados por las actividades económicas o profesionales enumeradas en el Anexo III, aunque no exista dolo, culpa o negligencia. Se presumirá, salvo prueba en contrario, que una actividad económica o profesional de las enumeradas en el Anexo III ha causado el daño o la amenaza inminente de que dicho daño se produzca cuando, atendiendo a su naturaleza intrínseca o a la forma en que se ha desarrollado, sea apropiada para causarlo. También se aplicará a los daños medioambientales y a las amenazas inminentes de que tales daños ocurran, cuando hayan sido causados por las actividades económicas o profesionales distintas de las enumeradas en el Anexo III.

Policy: Regional Law No. 141-KZ “On forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law, regulates the procedure for forest management in the regional territory for the purpose of harvesting food forest resources and collecting medicinal plants by citizens for their own needs, harvesting and collecting non-timber forest resources by citizens for their own needs, establishes the rules for the use of forests for hunting, the procedure and standards for timber extraction by citizens for their own needs, as well as exceptional cases of timber extraction on the basis of purchase and sale contract of forest plantations in the regional territory. It is prohibited to use for harvesting and collecting non-timber forest resources, for harvesting food forest resources and collecting medicinal plants, species of plants and mushrooms listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation, the regional Red Book or recognized as narcotic drugs. Citizens shall be authorized to use forests for the purpose of harvesting and collecting for their own needs the following food forest resources, medicinal plants and non-timber forest resources: (a) wild-growing fruits, berries and fruits; (b) birch juice; (c) fern; (d) medicinal plants; (e) tree stubs; (f) moss, forest floor, fallen leaves and reeds; (g) bark and bast; (h) fuelwood; (i) branch feed, tree branches, shrubs and their parts; and (j) fir, pine, spruce boughs.

Policy: Regional Law No. 51-RZ “On environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating from economic activity and other activities producing environmental impact. Objects of environmental protection against pollution, exhaustion, degradation, deterioration, destruction and other negative impact of economic and other activities shall be: (a) land, soil, subsoil; (b) surface water and groundwater; (c) forests and vegetation, wild fauna, animals, other organisms and genetic fund thereof; and (d) atmospheric air, ozone layer and outer space. Natural ecosystems, landscapes and natural complexes shall have priority protection (Art. 5). Each citizen shall have the right to favourable environment, protection thereof against negative impact, access to reliable information on the state of environment and compensation of environmental damages (Art. 11). Authorized state environmental bodies shall carry out environmental assessment of natural resources and registration thereof (Art. 15). Management of some natural resources shall subject to compulsory licensing (Art. 17). Ecological certification shall be carried out in order to ensure ecologically safe economic activities (Art. 19). Negative environmental impact shall require payment of fees (Art. 21). Enterprises, institutions and organizations, economic activity of which exercises direct or indirect environmental impact must be in possession of ecological certificate (Art. 37).  Expropriation of regional protected areas, except for cases envisaged by federal legislation, shall be prohibited (Art. 42).

Territorial forest management bodies shall have the right to concede in lease and tenancy of plots of forest fund for fee for short-term period of 5 years and for long-term period over 5 years. The latter can be extended for the period of 50 years. Plot of public forest (forest fund) van be concede in lease for carrying out the following forest uses: (a) agriculture (arable farming), haying, apiculture, collection of medicinal plants and alimentary forest products; (b) procurement of non-timber forest products; (c) scientific research, recreation, tourism, education and hunting; and (d) timber extraction. Lease of the plots of forest land shall be regulated by the principles of continuous, rational and sustainable forest management.

Policy: Decree No. 269 of 2007 (X. 18.) Korm. of the Government concerning the rules of land use for the maintenance of Natura 2000 grass lands.
Policy_Content: This Decree applies to the use of Natura 2000 grass lands and to their users. If these areas are protected areas as well, special provisions regarding protected areas are also to be applied. The use of Natura 2000 grass lands is regulated in Articles 3-5. Grazing is allowed only for certain animal species, over-grazing and manuring is prohibited. Reaping is also regulated in detail and irrigation is prohibited. Certain activities are subject to authorization. Non indigenous and invasive plant species are to be controlled by mechanical methods or special phytosanitary products.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1353 validating the Regulation on state registration in the area of environmental protection.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree requires state registration of all activities that have a negative environmental impact on the atmosphere, surface water or groundwater, land or soil, plants or animals, in order to: (a) prevent environmental pollution, degradation, damage, exhaustion and other negative impacts; (b) control environmental impacts and manage natural resources; (c) provide access to environmental information. State registration shall be based on the following principles: (a) efficiency; (b) coherence of information at all administrative levels; (c) complex information on environmental impacts; and (d) availability of information on the state of the environment and negative impacts thereon.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy_Content: Il est ajouté à l'annexe I de l'arrêté du 24 août 1998 un point 1.8, ainsi qu'à l'arrêté du 7 janvier 2003 modifié relatif aux prescriptions générales applicables aux installations classées soumises à déclaration sous les rubriques n° 1434 (Installation de remplissage ou de distribution de liquides inflammables) et/ou n° 1413 (Installation de distribution de gaz naturel ou de biogaz), un point 1.9,  relatifs aux contrôles périodiques. Ces contrôles ont pour objet de vérifier la conformité de l'installation aux prescriptions listées en annexe III, éventuellement modifiées par arrêté préfectoral, lorsqu'elles lui sont applicables. L'exploitant conserve le rapport de visite que l'organisme agréé lui adresse dans le dossier "installations classées prévu au point 1.4. Si le rapport fait apparaître des non-conformités aux dispositions faisant l'objet du contrôle, l'exploitant met en oeuvre les actions correctives nécessaires pour y remédier. Policy: Regional Law No. 143-OZ “On forest management for hunting”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that hunting management on forest parcels shall be carried out by legal persons and individual entrepreneurs in accordance with forest parcel lease contracts. Forest parcels for hunting management shall be allotted to the applicants through tenders. Hunting managers shall be granted the following rights: (a) carry out biotechnical arrangements (creation of feeding sites, artificial nests for birds and covers for wild fauna species); (b) procure forest resources, including non-timber forage, for organization of hunting; and (c) obtain information on forest parcels allotted for hunting. Hunting managers must: (a) use forest parcels for specified purposes in accordance with lease contract arrangements; (b) pay agreed rental fee within established deadline; (c) ensure protection and conservation of wild fauna species; and (d) observe forest fire and sanitary rules and regulations.

Policy: Programme for Implementation of Gender Equality 2007-2010
Policy_Content: The Programme is a medium-term policy planning document, which is developed for a time period of four years and includes both specific and horizontal measures for the implementation of gender equality. The Programme includes measures, which are already included in other intersectoral programmes in order to achieve as comprehensive an insight as possible, and it will be done in order to promote ensuring of gender equality. In performing mid-term evaluation of the Programme, the Programme will be revised and updated, possibly supplementing with new action directions and also measures. Objective of the Programme is to improve ensuring of equal opportunities and rights for women and men, as well as access to resources in all areas of life. In evaluating the situation and the tasks performed during the previous programming period, six action directions and corresponding sub-objectives have been specified within the Programme: (1) Educating of society regarding gender equality – to raise the awareness of society regarding gender equality issues; (2) Educating of State institutions of direct administration and other specialists regarding gender equality – to raise the awareness of institutions involved in the introduction of the gender equality policy regarding possibility of use of gender mainstreaming and significance thereof in sectoral policies; (3) Improving of the monitoring of implementation of gender equality policy – to improve the supervision and evaluation of the implemented gender equality policy; (4) Bringing forward of the domestic violence problem – to survey the situation and to develop conceptual solutions for the reduction of domestic violence; (5) Improvement of opportunities for the reconciliation of work and private life – to improve the opportunities for reconciliation of work and family life and to promote the interest of employers in creating opportunities for the reconciliation of work and family life; (6) Survey of lifestyle habits related to health – to survey and raise the awareness of residents regarding lifestyle habits, which are specifically characteristic to each gender, and the impact thereof on health and the quality of life. The main results of the implementation of the Programme will be an improvement of the situation in the application and use of equal rights and opportunities, which will be demonstrated by changes in several areas related to gender equality pursuant to the indicators characterising achievement of the sub-objectives of the Programme.

Policy: Regional Law No. 204-ZO “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs for housing construction, reconstruction and heating in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without tender and without allotment of forest parcels. Rates of timber extraction shall be set forth by the regional administration.  The period of validity of timber extraction authorization shall not exceed 12 months. Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for housing construction – up to 50 cubic metres per family once in 50 years; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 20 cubic metres once in 15 years; and (c) fuelwood for heating – up to 10 cubic metres annually.

Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto: 1) Establecer los criterios sanitarios que deben cumplir las aguas de baño, para garantizar su calidad con el fin de proteger la salud humana de los efectos adversos derivados de cualquier tipo de contaminación; 2) Conservar, proteger y mejorar la calidad del medio ambiente en complemento al texto refundido de la Ley de Aguas, aprobado por el Real Decreto Legislativo Nº 1/2001; 3) Establecer disposiciones mínimas para el control, la clasificación, las medidas de gestión y el suministro de información al público sobre la calidad de las zonas de aguas de baño. Esta disposición será de aplicación a las aguas de baño y su playa, quedando excluidas del ámbito de la aplicación: a) Las piscinas de natación y de aguas termales de estaciones balnearias y de balnearios urbanos; b) Las aguas confinadas de forma natural o artificial, sujetas a un tratamiento o empleadas con fines terapéuticos; c) Las aguas confinadas artificialmente y separadas de las aguas superficiales y de las aguas subterráneas, excepto las piscinas fluviales o similares.

Policy: Regulation on the manner and methodology of expert inspection of planting material production.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the manner and methodology of expert inspection of forest and horticultural production of planting material. The production of planting material of forest and horticultural varieties is defined in article 3 of the Federal Law on seeds and seedlings of forest and horticultural trees and shrubs. The production of forest and horticultural planting material is subject to mandatory expert inspection twice a year, at the beginning and at the end of the vegetation period (spring expert review and autumn expert review). This kind of expert inspection can be carried out several times at the request of the producer of planting material. The expert examination is performed by an institution authorized by the Federal Ministry of Agriculture, Water Management and Forestry.

Policy: The Uganda National Export Strategy 2008-2012
Policy_Content: The National Export Strategy (NES) is a sectoral strategy which focuses on how to revamp, develop and sustain the export growth in Uganda, over the medium term (2008-2012).   Firstly, it provides guidance to ensure that the scarce resources available for export development are allocated to the top priorities – sectoral, cross-sectoral and institutional. Secondly, the national Export Strategy provides the framework for the public and private sectors to work within a partnership to achieve mutually agreed objectives for Uganda’s export development. And thirdly, NES emphasizes the contribution of the export sector to the overall economic and social development of the country in terms of; foreign exchange earnings, employment creation, poverty eradication, regional development, gender equality, inclusion of disadvantaged groups, and environmental sustainability.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1619/342-IV-OZ “On forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes requirements for management of forests allotted for hunting. Hunting management shall be prohibited in green belts and forest parks. Forest parcels for hunting shall be conceded to natural and legal persons for hunting management in accordance with lease contracts. Hunting can be subject to restrictions for protection of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species. Hunting managers shall have the right: (a) to carry out biotechnical arrangements; (b) procure forest resources for rendering hunting services; and (c) obtain information on forest plots. Hunting mangers shall have the following duties: (a) observe forest legislation ensuring conservation of biological diversity; (b) observe forest fire safety, sanitary and reforestation arrangement; (c) prevent damages to forest vegetation; and (d) pay lease fees within established deadline.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates waste management originating either from domestic or from non-domestic sources and establishes plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of waste management. State support shall be granted to the following sectors: (a) stockbreeding; (b) plant production; (c) conservation and improvement of soil fertility; and (c) veterinary. Policy: Regional Law No. 169-ZO “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of constituting and ensuring conservation of regional protected areas and establishes the modalities of classification of protected areas of local significance. Protected areas shall be classified as follows: (a) state nature reserves; (b) natural parks; (c) nature monuments; (d) healthcare areas and spas; and (e) dendrological parks and botanical gardens. Protected areas of regional significance shall be regional property. Protected areas of local significance shall be property of local government and shall be managed thereby. Boundaries of protected areas shall be designated on site. Protected areas shall be taken into consideration in the process of land-use planning. Regional Government shall make decision on reservation of land destined for protected areas and shall impose restrictions on economic activities .

Policy: Loi fédérale sur la géoinformation (Loi sur la géoinformation, LGéo).
Policy_Content: La présente loi vise à ce que les autorités fédérales, cantonales et communales, les milieux économiques, la population et les milieux scientifiques disposent rapidement, simplement et durablement de géodonnées mises à jour, au niveau de qualité requis et d’un coût approprié, couvrant le territoire de la Confédération suisse en vue d’une large utilisation. Au sens de la présente loi, on entend par: géodonnées: données à référence spatiale qui décrivent l’étendue et les propriétés d’espaces et d’objets donnés à un instant donné, en particulier la position, la nature, l’utilisation et le statut juridique de ces éléments. Le texte comprend 46 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Principes (2); Mensuration nationale (3); Géologie nationale (4); Mensuration officielle (5); Organisation (6); Dispositions finales (7).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Décret n° 2007-610/PRES/PM/MAHRH du 04 octobre 2007 portant adoption de la politique nationale de sécurisation foncière en milieu rural.
Policy_Content: Est adoptée la politique nationale de sécurisation foncière en milieu rural du Burkina faso dont le texte est joint en annexe au présent  décret. La sécurisation foncière des acteurs ruraux est une condition incontournable pour un développement économique et social durable. Pour apporter des réponses efficaces  et durables au problème de la sécurisation foncière des acteurs ruraux, le gouvernement du Burkina Faso a décidé d’entreprendre l’élaboration d’un document de politique nationale de sécurisation foncière en milieu rural (PNSFMR). A travers l’élaboration de la PNSFMR, le gouvernement entend mettre à la disposition de l’ensemble des acteurs publics et privés un cadre politique cohérent de référence et un outil efficace d’aide à l’action. Il s’agit en particulier: de mettre en place une Administration foncière à même de gérer le foncier et de réguler les conflits fonciers en dotant  les différents services concernés de l’Etat d’un cadre clair et harmonisé de référence pour l’ensemble des actions entreprises par la puissance publique dans le domaine de la gestion et de la mise en valeur des terres rurales;  de favoriser une lisibilité des objectifs de l’action publique en matière foncière et d’obtenir l’adhésion des acteurs ruraux; de fournir des bases solides et consensuelles pour l’élaboration d’une future législation foncière rurale adaptée et effective.

Policy: Regional Law No. 275-Z “On regulation of some forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some forest relations originating from forest management, conservation and protection of forests. Citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of non-timber (edible and non-edible) forest resources free of charge for individual personal needs. Citizens must observe forest fire and sanitary rules and regulations in forests, afforestation and reforestation requirements, and care of forests. Stay of citizens in forests can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Forest Code. Natural persons shall be granted the right to timber extraction for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. Assessment of personal needs of timber for construction and repairs shall be performed by the local self-government in accordance with the application submitted by citizen after inspection of the applicant’s housing facilities.

Annual rate of timber extraction for individual personal needs shall be within the limits of authorized annual timber extraction. A citizen shall submit to the forest district authority application, specifying the amount of requested timber and purposeful use thereof. Procurement of  non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs shall be granted free of charge without any special authorization or permit.

Policy: Disaster Management Act 2006.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 25 sections, provides for the Creation of a National Disaster Management Council, a National Disaster Management Authority and other related matters. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institutions entitled to deal with  disasters and emergency as to require the entire government to act not only in disaster response, but in risk management, risk mitigation, preparedness, relief and recovery through capacity building at all levels, and established partnerships with organized communities and international organizations. The functions of the National Disaster Management Council shall be provide guidance, advice and approve all critical decisions on disaster management with the aim of: (i) Protecting the people’s safety, health, and quality of life as well as the nations economic viability; (ii) Building and maintaining partnerships and collaboration at all levels of government, community, corporate and voluntary sectors in all aspects of disaster management through a consultative decision-making process (iii) Building and maintaining partnerships and collaboration with other nations in the South Asia region on matters of disaster management; (iv) Building and maintaining partnerships and collaboration with international agencies and the rest of the international community; (v) Protecting the natural and built up environment; (vi) Building the capacity of communities to mitigate risks, prepare for, respond to, and recover from disasters; (vii) Ensuring accountability, transparency and fairness in the performance of its functions. (b) Approve the National Disaster Management Plan and the National Emergency Operations Plan, etc.

Policy: Regulation establishing requirements concerning measurement of levels in the environment by managers of road, railroad, tram road, airport or port.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment is composed of seven paragraphs and three Annexes. Exploitation of roads, railroads, tram roads, airports and ports must not cause exceeding standards of the environment quality. It relates to introduction of gas or dust into the air, introduction of effluent into waters or ground, wastes production and noise emission. Managers of roads, railroads, tram roads, airports and ports are obliged to periodical measurement of levels of substances or energy in the environment. This Regulation lays down requirements concerning these measurements, and establishes cases when required: (1) permanent measurement of levels of indicated substances or energy in the environment; (2) periodical measurement of levels of indicated substances or energy in the environment; (3) referential methods of measurement; (4) criteria of localization of measurement points; (5) ways of recording results of measurement.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Environmental standards,Noise pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge,Emissions,Pollution control,Water quality standards

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1075 validating the Regulation on agricultural land consolidation.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates arrangements undertaken by the owners of agricultural land, central governmental bodies and local self-government, territorial cadastre offices, legal and natural persons for the purpose of rational and efficient management of agricultural land. It regulates the actions by the subjects of the process of agricultural land consolidation through elaboration and realization of agricultural land consolidation project. The aforesaid project of agricultural land consolidation shall include complex arrangements with a view of creation of compact land plots and sustainable in the course of time and also rational use thereof. Purchase and trade, exchange of agricultural land and other arrangements undertaken by natural and legal persons outside consolidation project and without participation of local self-government shall not be considered consolidation of agricultural land and shall not enjoy state incentives conceded in accordance with the legislation currently in force.

Policy: Arrêté du 1er octobre 2007 définissant les modalités relatives à la protection contre la foudre des installations nucléaires de base secrètes et des installations de mise en oeuvre et de maintenance associées aux systèmes nucléaires militaires.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les règles destinées à prévenir et limiter les risques résultant d'une agression par la foudre: - des installations individuelles présentant les caractéristiques techniques définies par l'article 28-III de la loi du 13 juin 2006 relative à la transparence et à la sécurité en matière nucléaire; - des équipements et installations nécessaires à l'exploitation d'une installation nucléaire de base secrètes (INBS), conformément à l'article 2-III de la loi du 13 juin 2006 susvisée; - des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement (ICPE) comprises dans le périmètre d'une INBS; - des installations de mise en oeuvre et de maintenance associées aux systèmes nucléaires militaires (SNM). La foudre peut être à l'origine d'événements susceptibles de porter significativement atteinte, directement ou indirectement, à la sûreté nucléaire, à la radioprotection ou aux intérêts visés à l'article L. 511-1 du code de l'environnement. Aussi une analyse du risque foudre et une protection adéquate contre ses effets directs et indirects sont requises.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 500 validating the Concept of transition to sustainable development.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Governmental Decree shall be to overcome socio-economic difficulties and ecological crisis as soon as possible and improvement of the living standard of the population with a view of ensuring stable socio-economic development, conservation of healthy and favorable environment and rational management of natural resources for meeting the demand of the present and the future generations. This Concept shall not be considered as a separate plan but is aimed at adapting ongoing actions at the national and the regional levels to the principles of sustainable development. The main priorities shall include efficient economic activity, rational consumption and careful use of natural resources. In the process of the transition to sustainable development the main tasks of the national policy shall be set as follows: (a) poverty reduction; (b) food security; (c) ecological security; (d) energy security; and (e) efficient management.

Policy: Arrêté royal relatif aux modalités d'élaboration du rapport fédéral en matière d'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté royal est relatif aux modalités d'élaboration du rapport fédéral en matière d'environnement. L’article 2 établit que le rapport fédéral sur l'environnement contient les résultats d'un processus de rapportage. Ce processus de rapportage comporte trois éléments: 1) l'identification de la politique environnementale fédérale qui est menée durant un cycle de rapportage donné, ses objectifs et sa mise en oeuvre; 2) la collecte d'informations environnementales, dont des indicateurs et des données environnementales; 3) la détermination, au moyen d'indicateurs, de l'effectivité de la politique environnementale fédérale. Le texte comprend 9 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Définitions et dispositions générales (I); Procédures de dépôt du rapport fédéral de l'environnement et de la note sur les indicateurs environnementaux (II); Procédures d'élaboration, de coordination et de suivi du rapport fédéral de l'environnement et de la note sur les indicateurs environnementaux (III); Disposition final (IV).

Policy: Regional Law No. 52-ZRH “On forest management for hunting”.
Policy_Content: Forests can be used to carry out activities in the field of hunting. Forest areas shall be allotted to legal entities, individual entrepreneurs for the performance of activities in the field of hunting on the basis of hunting management contracts concluded in accordance with the federal law on hunting and the preservation of hunting resources, and lease agreements for forest areas. In forest areas allotted for the performance of activities in the field of hunting, it is allowed to create objects of hunting infrastructure in accordance with the federal law on hunting and the preservation of hunting resources. Individual entrepreneurs and legal entities that manage forests to carry out activities in the field of hunting, shall be authorized to: (a) carry out a set of biotechnical measures (installation of feeding grounds, planting fodder and protective plants, making artificial nesting sites and shelters for animals and birds and other activities); (b) to harvest wood-branch feed for wild fauna species; (c) to carry out the reconstruction of forest areas by forest management methods (afforestation and reforestation) including areas under low-value plantings, in accordance with the forest development project; (d) maintain and breed hunting resources in semi-free conditions in accordance with the requirements of the legislation of the Russian Federation on wild fauna; (e) to use the forest plot within the limits established by the lease agreement; (f) to erect temporary structures (hunting huts, cordons, towers, bird hides, hiding places for hunters, traps and other objects) for the duration of forest management, associated with the performance of this type of forest management; (g) to carry out, in coordination with the lessor, the construction and repair of roads necessary for the performance of this type of forest management; (h) to receive, in the established manner, information on the forest area transferred for the performance of this type of forest management; and (i) to exercise other rights if their implementation does not contradict the requirements of the legislation of the Russian Federation and the forest plot lease agreement.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No. 1322-KZ “On procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources, edible forest resources and collection of medicinal herbs by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: Citizens shall have the right to carry out procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources, edible forest resources (wild growing fruits, berries, nuts, mushrooms and other edible species) and collection of medicinal herbs by citizens for individual personal needs without any authorization and free of charge (art. 1). Procurement of boughs and root spurs of coniferous species shall be authorized from felled trees at timber extraction sites. Collection of non-timber forest resources shall be carried out by citizens in accordance with application approved by forest guard (art. 2). Collection of edible non-timber resources shall be carried out in the manner avoiding damages to fruit bearing plants (art. 3). Harvesting of protected mushrooms and wild growing plants recorded in the Red Book shall be prohibited (art. 4).
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 1321-KZ “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without allotment of forest parcels. Endangered and protected forest species shall be prohibited for timber extraction (art. 3). Application for conclusion of purchase and sale contract of forest species shall be submitted to the authorized state forest institution by the 10th of the established month (art. 4). Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for housing construction – up to 50 cubic metres per family; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 25 cubic metres once in 10 years; (c) for construction of dependency outbuilding – up to 20 cubic metres once in 10 years; and (d) fuelwood for heating – up to 15 cubic metres annually (art. 8).

Policy: Ley de Derechos y Cultura Indígena del Estado de Baja California.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto el reconocimiento, preservación y defensa de los derechos y cultura de los indígenas del Estado de Baja California, así como el establecimiento de las obligaciones de la administración pública estatal y municipal en la construcción de las relaciones con las comunidades indígenas y elevar el bienestar social de sus integrantes, promoviendo el desarrollo a través de programas y presupuestos específicos. Entre los derechos reconocidos a las comunidades indígenas se contemplan aquellos relativos al acceso a la tierra y los recursos naturales. La Ley dispone que las obras y proyectos que promuevan las autoridades estatales y municipales, las organizaciones o los particulares, que impacten a los pueblos y comunidades indígenas en sus recursos naturales, deberán ser discutidos, analizados y consensuados previamente con dichos pueblos y comunidades (art. 23). En cuanto a las tierras, se establece que las comunidades indígenas tienen el derecho de preferencia para adquirir los predios que enajenen o cedan la comunidad o alguno de sus integrantes. Los artículos 38 y 39 establecen los principios generales en materia de justicia indígena.

Policy: Regional Law No. 94-OZ “On procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of procurement of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs with the consideration of conservation, protection and reproduction of forests. It shall be applicable to non-edible non-timber forest products. Procurement and harvesting of non-timber resources shall be carried out on felling sites. Procurement of fuelwood shall be carried out all the year round with the diameter of dry wood non exceeding 4 cm from felled timber on felling sites. Collection and harvesting of forage non-timber resources can be carried out by citizens all the year round from felled timber in the process of clean cutting and selective cutting on felling sites. Methods used for procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources must prevent exhaustion of available forest resources and ensuring timely reproduction thereof.

Policy: Loi n°2007-055 du 18 septembre 2007 abrogeant et remplaçant la loi n° 97-007 du 20 janvier 1997 portant code forestier.
Policy_Content: La présente loi est composée de 84 articles repartis en onze (11) titres. Ce texte prévoit la mise en valeur des forêts (Titre II) et les défrichements des forêts: organisation, et lieux des défrichements (Titre III). En ce qui concerne le Domaine forestier de l'Etat, cette loi distingue deux catégories, d’une part, le Domaine classé constitué des forêts classées, des périmètres de protection ayant fait l’objet d’un texte de classement et les périmètres de reboisement, et d’autre part, le Domaine forestier Protégé composé du reste des terrains soustrait au défrichement, mais n’ayant pas fait l’objet d’un texte de classement les soumettant à un régime strict spécial concernant l’exercice des droits d’usage et d’exploitation (Titre IV). Par ailleurs, elle définit la procédure de classement et l’aliénation des forêts classées, les périmètres de protection et de reboisement. S’agissant des droits d’usage, ils sont définit comme les droits par lesquels les personnes physiques ou morales ou des collectivités locales s'approprient à titre temporaire ou définitif les produits de la forêt en vue de satisfaire un besoin individuel ou collectif et ne donnant lieu à aucune transaction commerciale, ce sont notamment le droits d’usage sur le sol forestier, la circulation à pied ou en véhicule à travers le périmètre classe, les pâturages pour les troupeaux d’animaux et les droit d’usage portant les fruits et les produits de la forêt naturelles. Ensuite, elle dresse la liste des essences forestières protégées sur l’ensemble du territoire dont l’arrachage, l’abattage ou la mutilation sont interdits sauf autorisation du Ministre en charge des forêts. Espèces protégées (Titre VI); exploitation du domaine forestier de l’Etat (Titre VII); Circulation des produits forestiers (Titre VIII); Domaine des collectivités et des particuliers (Titre IX); Feux de brousse (Titre X); Répressions des infractions: Procédure (recherche et constations des infractions, confiscation saisie, actions et poursuites), Infractions et pénalités: Transaction, dispositions pénales, infractions diverses (Titre XI). La présente loi organise la procédure de création, de gestion et de protection des forêts et terrains à boiser de l’Etat, des collectivités locales ou des particuliers; et des parcs, réserves et autres aires protégées.

Policy_Content: This Order has as its purpose the enforcement by the territorial bodies of the Federal Ecological, Technological and Nuclear Supervision Service, and by other federal and state institutions under its jurisdiction, of payments of environmental fees for negative environmental impacts, in particular for emissions into the atmosphere, control of data on emissions submitted by the payers of environmental fees and the modalities of calculation thereof. This Methodical Instruction shall be compulsory for all territorial bodies of the Service and for the state institutions under its control. The payers of environmental fees shall be legal persons, individual entrepreneurs and foreign natural persons carrying out activities (production, non-production and other areas) that have a negative environmental impact in the form of emissions into the atmosphere. Policy: Law No. 13/2007 establishing the Basic Law on Maritime Safety and Prevention of Marine Pollution.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 28 articles divided into five Chapters, provides for the policy on maritime safety and for preventing marine pollution. It institutes and regulates the National Maritime Safety System identifying also its managing bodies. Particular attention is paid to the reference of all applicable international treaties. The State shall ensure the safety of navigation, vessels, maritime and port traffic and all economic and leisure activities related to the sea, including the safeguard of human life at sea, welfare ships and the prevention of pollution of maritime waters under national jurisdiction. The policy on maritime safety and the prevention of pollution of the sea consists of a coherent set of principles, guidelines and measures for the continuous pursuit of the above mentioned provisions. The National Maritime Safety System is the institutional framework constituted by entities that, with coordination, executive or consultative functions, exercise power of State authority in the field of maritime safety and the prevention of pollution of the sea.

Policy: Arrêté di 11 septembre 2007 pris en application du décret nº 2007-1334 fixant les conditions d'attribution des indemnités compensatoires de handicaps naturels permanents dans le cadre de l'agriculture de montagne et des autres zones défavorisées et modifiant le code rural.
Policy_Content: Dans chaque département, un arrêté préfectoral précise les zones ou sous-zones départementales classées en zone défavorisée.  Un arrêté préfectoral annuel fixe, pour chaque zone défavorisée ou sous-zone départementale, la plage de chargement optimale, c’est à dire le rapport entre le nombre d’animaux converti en unités de gros bétail (UGB) et la surface fourragère de l’exploitation exprimée en hectares. Cette plage correspond à une exploitation optimale du potentiel fourrager. En dehors de cette plage optimale, des plages supplémentaires sont fixées, auxquelles sont attachées un taux de réduction s’appliquant au montant unitaire par hectare de l’indemnité. La différence de taux entre deux plages distinctes. doit être d’au moins 10 %.

Policy: Strategy and Action Plan for Food Security and Nutrition 2008-2015.
Policy_Content: The Strategy for Food Security and Nutrition (ESAN II) 2008-2015 results from the evolution of ESAN I approved by the Government of Mozambique in 1998, through the Internal Resolution 16/98. The ESAN II fits into national and international policies and international legislation. National policies emphasize the Agenda 2025, the Five-Year Government Programme, the Action Plan for the Reduction of Absolute Poverty (PARPA II), the National Strategic Plan to Combat HIV/AIDS, and the policies and strategies sectoral and multisectoral. The National Gender Policy advocate greater equality and equity of gender in development interventions and promotes the elevation of the Women's status in the governing bodies and the level of public administration. Thus, the government and society at large They have carried out actions to gradually overcome the existing imbalances at these levels. The Food Security and Nutrition Action Plan (PASAN) covers a time horizon from 2008 to 2015. The PASAN comes with the overall objective of contributing to the planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of actions that contribute paca improving the SAN among vulnerable populations, taking into account the various alimentares8 economies zones existing in the country.

Policy: Regulation on Tender, Award, and Administration of Forest Management Contracts, Timber Sale Contracts, and Major Forest Use Permits (FDA Regulation 104-07).
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Forestry Development Authority (FDA) governs tendering, awarding, and administering Forest Resources Licenses. The National Forestry Reform Law of 2006 establishes a transparent framework for the use, management, and protection of forest resources that balances the commercial, community, and conservation priorities of Liberia. Section 19 of that Law authorizes the Forestry Development Authority to issue regulations and other rules necessary to implement the Law (section 19.1(a)), including regulations that govern contracting and permitting (section 19.1(c)), and regulations that establish bonding requirements (section 5.1(e)). The Regulation sets out policy principles and requirements for and procedures of offering and administering Forest Management Contracts (FMCs), Timber Sale Contracts (TSCs), and Major FUPs (a Forest Use Permit that section 5.5(d)(i) of the Law requires the Authority to offer through a concessions process because the permit allows use of more than US $10,000 worth of Forest Resources). Successful bidders and Holders of FMCs and TSCs shall post an annual performance bond to assure payment of amounts due the Government, including taxes, fees, damages, and penalties. The Regulations also provides with respect to assignment of Contracts to third parties and the requirement that operations be in conformity with plans and (environmental impact) assessments.

Policy: Regional Law No. 168-OZ “On forest management for hunting”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that hunting management on forest parcels shall be carried out by legal persons and individual entrepreneurs in accordance with forest parcel lease contracts. Hunting managers shall be granted the following rights: (a) carry out improvement of forest parcels with a view of improvement of habitats of wild fauna species; and (b) keep and breed in semi-captive conditions wild fauna species subject to hunting. Hunting managers must: (a) ensure conservation of forest ecosystems; (b) observe forest fire and sanitary rules and regulations; (c) use forest parcels for specified purposes in accordance with lease contract arrangements; and (d) submit forest declaration to the lessor within the established deadline.
