Policy: Rural Development Strategy (EDR).
Policy_Content: This document is organized into five main chapters. Chapter 1, which corresponds to the Introduction, establishes the need for a rural development strategy in the context of Mozambique's growth and development, both now and in terms of its prospects for possible and desirable developments for the coming decades. Chapter 2 provides a brief overview of the current situation and future challenges in rural areas, highlighting the following facts: 1) By 2025, Mozambique will have more inhabitants; 2) The strong rural exodus is partly associated with urbanization and migration, but also denounces weaknesses in the rural economy; 3) One-third of the peasants are under 19 years of age; 5) Low productivity and rural agricultural production are worrisome; 6) The current national economic growth is based on a strong dependence on the urban economy and foreign aid; 7) Human development has improved and poverty is declining but remain very differentiated and unequal in social and regional terms. Chapter 2 ends with a summary of strengths and weaknesses, threats and opportunities in rural areas, as well as the determinants of changing the pattern of rural development.

Policy_Content: This National Adaptation Plan for Action (NAPA) is a multi-sectoral policy document. The NAPA was developed  by evaluating the impacts of climate change on the relevant sectors. The sectors that were analyzed are agriculture and food security (livestock, fisheries and crops), energy and water, human health, natural resources and wildlife. Policy: National Water Services Strategy (NWSS) (2007 – 2015).
Policy_Content: This National Water Services Strategy is a result of the water sector reform as introduced by the Water Act, 2002. The Water Act 2002 in sections 49 and 50 provides for a National Water Services Strategy to be adopted which aims at having a capable person at all times in every area of Kenya, providing water and sanitation services, to arrange for investments and implementation plans and to provide for national monitoring and information systems on water services. The Strategy addresses the challenge in providing sustainable access to safe water, sewerage systems and basic sanitation for Kenya's fast growing population. Sustainable access to safe water and basic sanitation is still declining in terms of quality and quantity. The main reasons are old infrastructure, inadequate management and maintenance of existing infrastructure, insufficient sustainability, investments not enough concentrating on the options of fast tracking access and informal service provision operating outside a framework of basic standards and regulation. There exist extremely high levels of unaccounted for water.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1505/313-IV-ОЗ “On rules for forest management by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations concerning timber extraction, collection and harvesting of edible (wild growing berries, nuts, mushrooms, seeds, birch juice) and non-edible non-timber forest products, collection and harvesting of medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs. It establishes that citizens shall be granted the right to procure edible and non-edible non-timber forest products and to collect and to harvest medicinal plants for individual personal needs free of charge. Timber extraction, collection and harvesting of edible and non-edible non-timber forest products, collection and harvesting of medicinal plants for individual personal needs shall not be considered entrepreneurial activity. Procurement of protected plant species and other non-timber forest products by citizens for individual personal needs shall be prohibited. Timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs shall be authorized for heating, housing construction and unspecified purposes in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates timber extraction of forest species by citizens for individual personal needs (non-commercial purposes) for housing construction, re-construction, repairs and heating of residential facilities. Timber extraction shall be carried out in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species, growing in public forest, concluded without tender. Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for individual housing construction – up to 150 cubic metres once-only; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 35 cubic metres once in fifteen years per family; (c) fuelwood for heating – up to 15 cubic metres annually.

Policy: Ethiopia Commodity Exchange Proclamation (No. 550 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Proclamation establishes the Ethiopia Commodity Exchange as a wholly state-owned market institution having its own legal personality. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall be the supervising authority of the Exchange. The Exchange shall be an efficient, transparent, and orderly marketing system for the trading in agricultural commodities that serves the needs of buyers, sellers, and intermediaries, and that promotes increased market participation of Ethiopian small scale producers. The Exchange shall develop and maintain approved grades and standards for the purposes of trading on the Exchange. The Proclamation provides rules for trading and makes provision for a dispute resolution mechanism.

Policy: Sub-Decree No. 114 ANKr.BK on the Mortgage and Transfer of the Rights Over a Long-Term Lease or an Economic Land Concession.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Sub-Decree is to determine principles and terms and conditions for granting rights to investors to put up as security and transfer of rights over a long-term lease or an economic land concession during the period of time not exceeding the prescribed period  in the long-term lease or the economic land concession agreement. A mortgage or transfer of rights shall not extend to the mortgage or the transfer of the concessionary land or the long-term leased land that the investor receives from the State. The investor cannot transfer or mortgage the rights over an economic land concession which has not been developed in conformity with the conditions of the economic land concession agreement. A land concession is the legal right granted in a legal document issued by a competent authority to occupy a land and to exercise the rights thereon in accordance with specific terms and condition. A land concession can only create rights for the period specified in the agreement establishing such economic land concession. The right over land concession cannot create ownership on the conceded land for the benefit of the concessionaire. Only immovable property registered in the Master Land Register can be subject of a concession or long-term lease. The land concession or long-term lease shall be mentioned on the land title certificate at the Ministry of Land Management, Urban Planning and Construction. The Ministry of Land Management, Urban Planning and Construction shall issue “Certificates of long-term lease” and “Certificates of economic land concession”.

Policy: Urban Planning Act, 2007 (No. 8 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to the procedures and processes of urban planning in mainland Tanzania. It is mainly is about control of and consent to urban development. The Act sets out the fundamental principles of urban planning and the objectives of land use planning in urban areas and formulates the conditions for transfer of village or reserved land to general land ensuring to incorporate the gender perspectives. Where the establishment, conferment of status and expansion of boundaries of a local government urban authority engulfs villages, such villages shall be de-registered pursuant to the relevant local government law. Any urban authority and district authority shall incorporate in the detailed planning scheme, land use plan of villages within its area of jurisdiction. A resolution by the relevant planning authority of intention to make a detailed planning scheme shall be a cause for transfer of land from village or reserved land to a general land. The Act also deals with reserving land for urban agriculture and is about protecting the environment. The Minister shall, after consultation with the Ministers responsible for natural resources and environment, by an order published in the Gazette, determine and declare beaches wetlands, mountainous areas and coastline to be special planning areas. Development requires planning consent and may require an environmental impact assessment report.

Policy: Ordonnance n° 07/064 du 24 aout 2007 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement de la Commission Permanente des Frontières en République Démocratique du Congo.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance crée une Commission Permanente des Frontières en République Démocratique du Congo (CPF). La Commission Permanente des Frontières exerce notamment les attributions suivantes : formuler des propositions au Gouvernement sur toutes questions se rapportant à la conception, à la coordination et à la mise en œuvre de la politique nationale des frontières, notamment par la création des mécanismes et programmes susceptibles de prévenir les conflits frontaliers et de promouvoir la coopération transfrontalière en vue d’assurer le développement et la sécurité des zones frontalières ; assurer, en liaison avec les Ministères et les services concernés, toutes études, toutes actions de suivi et de sensibilisation relatives à la définition, à l’efficacité, à la stabilité et à la valorisation des frontières nationales ; dresser à l’intention du Gouvernement congolais un rapport trimestriel sur l’état des frontières congolaises ; attirer l’attention des responsables politiques et administratifs sur les démarcations inachevées et autres tracés irréguliers (terrestres et maritimes) susceptibles d’engendrer des problèmes des frontières, et assurer l’entretien de celles déjà démarquées ; préparer les dossiers techniques en vue du règlement diplomatique, arbitral ou judiciaire de tout différend frontalier opposant la République Démocratique du Congo à un autre Etat, et en assurer le suivi ; désigner, chaque fois que cela est nécessaire, les délégués congolais à la commission spéciale mixte chargée de l’examen d’un différend frontalier avec un Etat voisin de la République Démocratique du Congo ; et constituer une banque des données en vue d’une gestion rationnelle des frontières de la République Démocratique du Congo.

Policy: Regional Law No. 64-ZKO “On forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates timber extraction, harvesting of edible and non-edible non-timber forest resources, collection of medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs, use of forests for hunting, and also exclusive cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species. Citizens shall be granted the right of timber extraction for heating, housing construction and other individual personal needs through selective and clear cutting in accordance with purchase and sale contract of timber forest species. Timber extraction shall be performed prior issuance of felling authorization by the authorized state regional forest institution. Stay of citizens in forests and collection of non-timber forest resources shall be performed free of charge within established limits.

Policy: Guyana Forestry Commission Act 2007.

The Commission shall encourage the development and growth of forestry in Guyana on a sustainable basis. The Commission shall, among other things: develop a forestry policy; provide an inspection, certification and accreditation service for quality control of forest produce; and administer the Forests Act 2007. The Commission is responsible to the Minister for the discharge or its functions. Art. 4 specifies allowable values of determined parameters of noise and infrasound and locations covered. Policy: Regional Law No. 100-OZ “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without tender. Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for individual housing construction – up to 150 cubic metres once in twenty years; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 25 cubic metres once in 10years per family; (c) fuelwood for heating – up to 20 cubic metres annually. Regional authorities shall establish annually total allowable standing timber for timber extraction.

Policy: Resolución Nº 292-2007-JUS ─ Crea el Programa Nacional de Enseñanza Legal para la Inclusión Social (PRONELIS).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea el Programa Nacional de Enseñanza Legal para la Inclusión Social (PRONELIS), con la finalidad de brindar a la población el conocimiento y concientización sobre la existencia de los Derechos Constitucionales que les permita acceder a la justicia de manera efectiva. Constituyen objetivos del Programa PRONELIS: 1) Difundir el conocimiento de los derechos que reconoce la Constitución Política entre la población en situación de pobreza y extrema pobreza, a través de la formación y capacitación de promotores legales de base, los cuales por efecto multiplicador extiendan sus conocimientos a un número mayor de personas; 2) Crear conciencia del ámbito de protección legal que otorga la Constitución Política del Estado, al poblador de sectores ubicados en zonas de pobreza y extrema pobreza; 3) Fortalecer el Estado de Derecho a través de un efectivo conocimiento ciudadano de las distintas instituciones del sistema de administración de justicia y del Estado en general; 4) Generar en la población beneficiaria un clima de confiabilidad en las instituciones públicas, a las cuales recurrir para acceder a la justicia, en casos de violación o amenaza de vulneración de los derechos que la Constitución les reconoce; 5) Propiciar la solución de conflictos sociales a través de los mecanismos legales, proscribiendo los métodos denominados de “justicia por mano propia”.

Policy: Regional Law No. 123-Z “On exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species for public and municipal needs. Exceptional cases shall be considered: (a) timber extraction for the prevention of natural and technological disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof; (b) timber extraction for construction purposes for repairs of public edifices damaged as a result of natural or technological disasters; (c) timber extraction by the producers of agricultural commodities for construction and re-construction of maintenance buildings for agricultural purposes; (d) procurement of fuelwood for public edifices; and (e) procurement of fir trees (spruces) and other coniferous forest species for New Year festivities (art. 1). Quantification of the amount of timber extraction for the aforesaid purposes shall be established by the Governor (art. 2).

Policy: Stratégie de Développement Accéléré et de Réduction de la Pauvreté 2008-2012.
Policy_Content: Pour rendre opérationnelle sa Stratégie de Réduction de la Pauvreté (SRP) de 2002, le Niger a élaboré la Stratégie de Développement Accéléré et de Réduction de la Pauvreté (SDRP, 2008-2012). L’objectif global assigné à la nouvelle SDRP est d’améliorer le bien-être des nigériennes et des nigériens. De manière spécifique, il s’agit de réduire la pauvreté dans toutes ses dimensions. Afin d’atteindre les objectifs susmentionnés, la SDRP sera mise en œuvre autour de sept (7) axes stratégiques: la recherche d’une croissance forte, diversifiée, durable et créatrice d’emplois (Axe 1); l’accès équitable aux services sociaux de qualité (Axe 2); la maîtrise de la croissance démographique (Axe 3); la réduction des inégalités et le renforcement de la protection sociale des groupes vulnérables (Axe 4); le développement des infrastructures (Axe 5); la promotion d’une gouvernance de qualité (Axe 6); la mise en œuvre efficace de la stratégie de réduction de la pauvreté (Axe 7).

Policy_Content: The main objective of the National Strategy for Water Resources Management is to effectively implement the Water Policy, aiming to meet the basic needs of water supply for human consumption, improved sanitation, efficient use of water for economic development, water for environmental conservation, reduction of vulnerability to floods and droughts, and promoting peace and regional integration, as well as guaranteeing water resources for the development of the country. To achieve the development goals, it is necessary to implement the priority projects and water resources management plans, including, in particular: water resources assessment; monitoring of water resources; river basin management plans; disaster risk analysis and management; international rivers' management; consolidation of the Regional Water Administrations. This strategy addresses all natural aspects of water resources systems, including surface and groundwater, water quality, pollution and protection of ecosystems, water use in all sectors of the national economy, legal and institutional framework, institutional capacity building and issues related to national development and regional integration (pag. 7).

Policy: Resolution CONAMA No. 393 providing for the continuous disposal of process or production water on offshore oil and natural gas platforms.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 16 articles, provides for the continuous disposal of process or production water on offshore oil and natural gas platforms, as well as establishes standards for the disposal of oils and greases, and defines monitoring parameters. Process waters may only be discharged, directly or indirectly, in the sea if comply with conditions, standards and requirements set forth in this Resolution and if do not change characteristics of the water class for the defined area, with the exception of the mixing zone. For the purpose of this Resolution, the mixing zone is limited to a radius of 500 m from the discharging point. For platforms at less than 12 nautical miles from the coast, the possibility of discharging process water and its conditions will be defined by the competent environmental authority based on a water dispersion study. The disposal of process water within a radius of less than 10 km of conservation units and 5 km of ecologically sensitive areas is prohibited.

Policy: Decree on principles and procedures regarding drought management.
Policy_Content: This Decree lays down the principles and procedures to be applied in case of drought. This Decree covers water management, agricultural techniques, seed and plant diversity, irrigation techniques, economic and social support, planning of pasture feeding and land use, pest management and any measures to implement urgent action and restrictions in arid and irrigated agricultural land. Moreover, it sets up the related institutional framework, which includes the following: Agricultural Drought Management Board; Monitoring and Early Warning Committee; Risk Assessment Committee; Flow Data Unit. The main task of such institutions is to carry out measurements, to compile and assess inventory and monitoring data, to conduct risk analysis, to define the water potential as well as to draw up the plan of interventions to be implemented in case of water shortage. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Ministry of Environment and Forestry and the Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources will coordinate their activities in this field.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 334-p validating the Regulation on state biological reserve “Ubeysko-Salbinsky”.
Policy_Content: State biological reserve “Ubeysko-Salbinsky” is protected area of regional significance, formed without expropriation of land plots form landowners, land tenants and land managers for an unlimited period of time. State biological reserve “Ubeysko-Salbinsky” was organized with the aim of protecting and reproducing hunting and game wild fauna species, preserving and restoring the number of rare and endangered species of animals and birds, valuable in economic, scientific and aesthetic terms, as well as protecting their habitats. The reserve was organized to fulfill the following tasks: (a) preservation of biodiversity of the unique natural landscape in the south of the Krasnoyarsk Territory; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for the reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the regional Red Book; and (c) monitoring of the natural environment, fauna, research work. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) hunting; (b) industrial fisheries; (c) final felling and selective felling for timber extraction; (d) procurement of soft resin; (e) drainage, irrigation and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) logging; (h) procurement of food forest resources, medicinal plants, non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens for their own needs); (i) burning of vegetation; (j) storage of pesticides, chemical reagents and other materials dangerous for wild fauna species and habitats thereof, except for places specially equipped for the storage of hazardous substances; (k) littering of the territory with household waste; (l) use of pesticides, chemical reagents and other hazardous substances; (m) the passage and parking of motor vehicles off public roads, except for the transport of bodies exercising protection and control over the observance of the established regime or other rules for the protection and use of natural resources on the territory of the reserve, as well as special equipment for carrying out agricultural work and forestry activities, reproduction and protection of natural resources; (n) construction of roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, allotment of land and the construction of buildings and structures of a permanent or temporary type outside the boundaries of municipalities, with the exception of buildings necessary for the protection and state control of the territory of the reserve; and (o) destruction or damage of installed warning or information signs (notices). Local residents shall have the right to timber extraction for their own personal needs. Recreational and sport fishing shall be authorized in conformity with acting legislation. Shooting of wild animals for scientific purposes and regulation of their number on the territory of the reserve is carried out according to permits issued in accordance with the current legislation. Siberian red deer (Cervus elaphus sibiricus) breeding on the territory of the reserve (south of the Dzhezlyk and Ustug rivers) is carried out with a license from specially authorized state bodies for the protection, control and regulation of the use of wildlife species and their habitats. On the territory of the reserve, cattle grazing is authorized, if this does not contradict the objectives of the statute of the reserve and the regime of its protection.

Policy: Arrêté du ministre de l'énergie et des mines n° 1546-07 du 3 août 2007 relatif aux caractéristiques des grands produits pétroliers.
Policy_Content: Les produits pétroliers énumérés ci-après: supercarburant sans plomb , gasoil 50 ppm de soufre et fuels, devront, lorsqu’ils seront détenus en vue de la vente, mis en vente ou vendus après leur livraison à la consommation intérieure, être conformes aux caractéristiques correspondant à leur dénomination. Ces caractéristiques fixent pour chaque produit ses propriétés physiques ou chimiques et en particulier tout ou partie des caractères suivants : couleur, viscosité, dépôt par refroidissement, point d’’éclair, tension de vapeur, caractéristiques de combustion, point d'écoulement, température limite de filtrabilité, acidité, propriétés corrosives et anticorrosives, teneurs limites en impuretés diverses telles qu’eau, sédiments, soufre et en additifs ou agents traceurs.
Subject: Energy, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Sustainable Development Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to ensure that present and future generations enjoy a better quality of life, by accomplishing sustainable development and participating in international efforts to implement sustainable development. For the purpose of the present Act the term «sustainable development» means development based on sustainability that is implemented simultaneously in the pursuit of economic growth, social stability and integration, and the preservation of the environment. The text consists of 22 articles divided into 5 chapters as follows: General provisions (I); Basic strategy for sustainable development (II); Evaluation of sustainability (III); Commission on Sustainable Development (IV); Supplementary provisions (V).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 746-ZS “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates forest relations on the regional territory. Regional Legislative Assembly shall adopt regional laws regulating forest relations and shall supervise over implementation and application thereof. Regional forest administration shall adopt bylaws regulating forest relations, establish rates of payment for forest resources and public forest areas with a view of concession on lease thereof, establish rates of payment for timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species and establish the modalities of conclusion of the aforesaid contracts. This Regional Law grants citizens the right of timber extraction, as fuelwood for heating, for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species with maximum period of validity of one year. It also establishes rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Fuelwood,Forest species,Contract/agreement
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Act on the Conservation and Management of Uninhabited Islands.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to the promotion of public welfare with the systematic management of uninhabited islands and surrounding waters by prescribing matters necessary for the conservation and management of uninhabited islands and surrounding waters. In particular, the State and local governments shall formulate and execute policies necessary for the proper conservation and management of uninhabited islands, such as protecting uninhabited islands and surrounding waters from being damaged, or indiscreetly utilized or developed. The text consists of 37 articles.

Policy: Development and Management of Deep Sea Water Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to ensure that the State preserves and manages deep sea water and develops or uses deep sea water in an environmentally friendly manner for future generations and the public interests, thereby contributing to the healthy life of nationals and the support and development of related industries. For the purpose of the present Act the term "deep sea drinking water" means water manufactured or processed to ensure that people can drink deep sea water in daily life, satisfying standards for water quality; the term "sea water intake area" means a sea area equipped with submarine topography and water quality suitable for the steady intake of deep sea water; the term "deep sea water development business" means storing, processing, supplying or selling deep sea water after the intake of deep sea water; the term "business related to deep sea water" means a business using deep sea water, such as a deep sea water development business, the business of manufacturing deep sea drinking water or the business of importing deep sea drinking water.The text consisting of 58 articles deals, inter alia, with the following aspects: Master Plans on deep sea water, Restrictions on development of deep sea water, Designation, etc. of sea water intake area, License, Authorization of implementation plans, Reporting on business, Standards for quality of deep sea water, fees, permission, standards for water quality, deep sea drinking water, measures to preserve the marine environment, inspection, certificates, state subsidy, support for research and development, water quality supervisors, penalties.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 29215 - Reglamento de la Ley Nº 1715 del Servicio Nacional de Reforma Agraria.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto reglamentar la Ley Nº 1.715 del Servicio Nacional de Reforma Agraria, regulando los aspectos relacionados con los procedimientos agrarios administrativos. Asimismo, establece el carácter social del derecho agrario, el que consiste, entre otras cosas, en la equidad en el derecho de acceso y tenencia de la tierra de mujeres y hombres, con preferencia a quienes no la tienen o la tienen insuficientemente (art. 3º). Además, el Decreto define con detalle la estructura y el funcionamiento del marco institucional previsto por la Ley, que está compuesto por la Comisión Agraria Nacional y las Comisiones Agrarias Departamentales, además del Instituto Nacional de Reforma Agraria.
